loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 59 years old and married with five children. Carmelita works very hard to provide for her family.

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, snack foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Carmelita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, snack foods, shampoo, soap, conditioner, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Carmelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, snack foods, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Claudia is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Claudia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Claudia requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Claudia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Claudia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Cheza

texts.en:
Cheza is 22 years old and single.

Cheza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, coffee, soft-drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Cheza has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from selling beauty products.

Cheza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, coffee, soft-drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria has very high interest in doing business, she has been involving in business activities since 2014, with her own working capital of $400.00, and she make her best on it. She has a small store so she is requesting a loan of $1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital because her capital is not enough. She will use this loan to buy more additional items to keep in her store including noodles, salt, cooking oil, sardines, biscuit, candles, soy sauce, slippers, sardines and other things to sell Including soft drinks . With this loan  she still wants to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy noodles, salt, cooking oils, sardines, biscuits, candles, soy sauce, slippers

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is applying for a loan of $ 1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business and she will use this to buy children's clothes, female clothes, men's clothes, shirt, sock, stocking, singlet, undershirt, slumber wear and other things. 

She has a shop of second hand clothes and she also selling in the market. Teresa has been involving in business activities a month ago, she started with her own working capital of $400.00. She is earning a good income from selling her second clothes because many people like to buy it, it is cheap and unique. If compare to new clothes. So she is still happy to do her business.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes, female clothes, men's clothes,, shirts, socks, singlet, undershirt, slumber wear and other things..

loans.name: Naranjito Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Naranjito es un grupo nuevo que se esfuerza para poder seguir creciendo, son de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona rural, de difícil acceso, donde todas quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Victoriana es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una pequeña despensa, con todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y da a sus clientes todo lo que piden. Ella comenta que con mucho sacrificio se ha abierto camino y hoy día ya tiene muchos clientes que siempre compra de ella los productos que tiene.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para la venta, como ser verduras, frutas, panificados, bebidas, y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The members of the Naranjito community bank organized recently to support the efforts of all to grow their respective businesses.  The group's members live in Curuguaty, a town in a rural part of the country that is not easily accessible from other parts.  
Our member, Victoriana, owns a small grocery.  She sells the everyday products that her customers most need.  She tells us that the sacrifices that she had to make to start the business were worthwhile because she has many regular customers now.  
Victoriana is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her grocery with the merchandise she sells: vegetables, fruits, bread products, soft drinks and other grocery products.  She is grateful to all of you for your loans and says that your investment will help her to grow her business.

loans.use: to stock her grocery business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a businesswoman who earns income hrough retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental and supports her children by building houses from the ground up. She has successfully repaid her loan, which she used to buy building materials, paint, and to pay her workers. She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building material, paint and to pay her workers

loans.name: Leocadio

texts.en: Leocadio is a pensioner-member of Paglaum MPC. He always makes himself available to participate in various activities of the cooperative despite his age. He is 75 years old, married and lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Leocadio makes sure that he can repay his loans without default to maintain good standing in his membership. Currently, he is taking out a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 41 years old, married and has four children who are all in school.

Catherine is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Catherine requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins.

Catherine has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Catherine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 60 years old and married with five children. Rosario works very hard to provide for them.

Rosario runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries.

Rosario has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Rosario would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Teresita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Tomás Antonio

texts.es:
Tomas es un hombre de 42 años vive en una comunidad llamado San Pablo Jocopilas, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos ya no estudian, pero la más pequeña estudia tercero primaria.
Tomas vive en una zona donde se produce mucho café, pues viendo toda esta producción él desde hace 20 años tomo la iniciativa de cultivar café, él cultiva muy constantemente y por los años de experiencia conoce diversidad de café,  él es muy reconocido por la gente y por la calidad del producto que cultiva, pues gracias a Dios el siempre cultiva, y esta es la manera como Tomas genera sus ingresos, Tomas para poder mejorar sus ingresos cultiva también milpa y trabaja como jornalero.
Con lo poco que gana Tomas apoya a sus hijos, pero para él,  esto no es suficiente y con el afán de seguir prosperando con su cultivo, solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de fertilizantes para que su próximo cultivo de café sea la mejor producción y obtenga de ello la mejor ganancia.
Tomas seguirá luchando con su cultivo, para que una parte de sus ingresos abone al préstamo y la otra cubrir otros gastos, y de igual forma sus hijos tendrán que contribuir en algo para aportar en lo que necesita la familia como alimentación, vestuario, y otras necesidades.
texts.en:
Tomas, 42, lives in a community called San Pablo Jocopilas. He has three children, two are no longer studying, but the youngest is studying in third grade.

Tomas lives in an area where a lot of coffee is produced. Seeing all of this production, 20 years ago he took the initiative to grow coffee. He grows constantly and with years of experience he knows the diversity of coffee. He is very well known by people and for the quality of his produce, since thanks to God he always grows coffee. This is how Tomas earns an income. In order to increase his income he also grows maize and works as a day labourer.

With the little than Tomas earns he supports his children, but for him this is not enough. With the goal of continuing to prosper, he is asking for a loan which he will use to buy fertilizers so that his next coffee harvest will be even better and he can increase his income. Tomas will continue striving with his crops, so that a part of his income will go to the loan and another to cover other costs, and equally his children will have to contribute something to support the family with the things they need such as food, clothing and other necessities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is 75 years old. She is known in the Pelong, Aloran-Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental area for her sari-sari (variety) store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably in a decent house for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is thankful for the times when all her financing needs of her retailing business have been supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 52 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Delia works very hard to provide for them.

Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Delia has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elena is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Elena has a food vending business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elena has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Renelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Renelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Renelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia works hard to support herself. She is single and has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines.

Dionesia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell.

Dionesia has been in this business for 15 years now, and also earns additional income from firewood retail.

In the future, Dionesia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is 29 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Mabel works very hard to provide for them.

Mabel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Mabel has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future, Mabel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 43 years old and has four children. Dioscora is married and has three children who are in school.

Dioscora is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Dioscora requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Dioscora has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dioscora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Florencia is 55 years old and has five children who are in school.

Florencia has a selling fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. Florencia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fruits and vegetables to sell to customers.

Florencia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Florencia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.en:
Sebastiana Lives in Dili, She is a business woman so she is applying for a loan of $ 600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more clothes such as school trousers, fabric sarum, children's clothes, fabrics, batik shirts and other things to sell. 

Sebastiana opened her business in 2011 with her working capital of $ 400.00. She does not sell every day, she was just selling at market days, because where there is market day she would go sell there, but she is earning a good income from her business because many people are interested in her clothes, So she is very happy to do her business. And with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she hopes to get a good management for her business.

loans.use: To buy school trousers, fabric sarum, children's clothes, fabrics, batik shirts and other things to sell.

loans.name: Afliana

texts.en:
Afliana live in Dili, She is apply for a loan $800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as cooking oiils, coffee, candies, Aqua, battery, hand body lotion and other things to sell. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2001, with her own working capital. 

She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Her independent because she can be responsible for her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cooking oils, coffee, candy, water, battery, hand and body lotion and other things to sell.

loans.name: Ra'uf

texts.en:
Ra'uf is a 29-years-old married man from Deir Al-balah city, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely covers all the family needs. However, he wants to improve his family standard of living help them live more comfortably.

Ra'uf took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Ra'uf will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also to decreasing the electricity expenses.
Ra'uf appears in the photo

loans.use: in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham is a 30-years-old married man from Jabalia city, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely covers all the family needs. However, he wants to improve his family standard of living help them live more comfortably.

Haitham took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Haitham will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also to decreasing the electricity expenses.
Haitham appears in the photo

loans.use: in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Nueva Amistad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA AMISTAD” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jenny es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chocolates, venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de muebles, venta de DVD’s, venta de calzados, venta de artefactos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jenny es integrante, ella indica que hace 8 meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de chocolates; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su papá, hace cinco años.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de cacao por mayor) que adquirirá de Alto Beni Yungas, con esta compra la señora podrá elaborar más chocolates para posteriormente comercializarlo en Villazón ubicado en el Departamento de Potosí. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera. 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “NUEVA AMISTAD” credit group is in its third cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Villa Tejada center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors if which Jenny is the president. The businesses that the members of the credit group have are varied. Among them are selling chocolate, selling food, selling furniture, selling DVD’s, selling shoes and selling appliances.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Jenny. She says that she joined Pro Mujer 8 months ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Right now, she has a business making and selling chocolates. She reports that she learned this business from her father five years ago.

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying cacao wholesale that she will acquire from Alto Beni Yungas. With this purchase, she can make more chocolates and later sell them in Villazón, located in the department of Potosí. This work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, since she is single.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the area of health that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cacao wholesale.

loans.name: Thức

texts.en:
Thức has worked in agriculture raising poultry for four years. He lives in Thieu Hoa district, in a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. His family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

In 2015, Thức joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve his business. Thức has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Thức is that their latrine is not hygienic. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Thức hopes to buy land of his own, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Dũng

texts.en:
Mr Dũng is 44 years old and he is married.  He has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 4 years.Dũng lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
His family is a low-income household in a village.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns his is the latrine is not hygienic. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build toilet.

In 2015, Dũng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve his  business. Dũng has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With his business profit, Dũng hopes for his business to do well, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: purchase materials to build a hygienic toilet for his family

loans.name: Fishing Village - N11Thhòaqnham Group

texts.en:
Mr Qúy is 26 years old and he is married with no children. He has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for 5 years. Qúy lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
His income is lower than the national average income, moreover the market need is low in this region.
 
The main hardship that Qúy faces is lack of capital.  He is requesting a loan to purchase processed seafood to resell.
This is Qúy first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

He is the group leader of the "Fishing village - N11ThHòaQNham", which consists of 3 members.
His income each month is low, Quý has not a house of his own, and his family is living in his parents' house. With his business profit, Qúy hopes for his business to do well, to buy land of his own, and to be able to build a small house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Unity Is Strength - N23Tânhưnghlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thảo is 38 years old and she is married with 3 children. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years.
Thảo lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Thảo faces is lack of capital.  
She is a reputable person in the community.

Although this is Thảo  first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, every members agreed to vote her to be the leader of "Unity is strength - N23TânHưngHLộc" group.

She is requesting a loan to purchase sea food to resell.
With her business profit, Thảo hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more sea food to resell

loans.name: Centula

texts.es:
Centula tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo en una zona rural en el centro poblado Collique que pertenece al distrito de Zaña que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Centula se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Centula espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Centula is 53 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in the rural part of Collique village in the district of Zaña which is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work mainly in agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.

Centula works raising and selling goats. Her business is located at her house. She has 5 years experience with her business and has very good personal and work references from her district. The loan will be used to buy a greater number of animals as well as buying balanced feed for them. Doing this Centula hopes to offer higher production to her clients which would allow her greater income and in the end improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater number of animals and balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 52 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Wilma is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Wilma has been pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Laida

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Laida works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Laida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Laida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dianela

texts.en:
Dianela is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Dianela dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ilia Piedad

texts.es: Piedad a sus 32 años de edad está divorciada, Piedad tiene  un hijo de 17 años y una hija de 14 años, los 2 están estudiando, Piedad atiende 5 años su negocio que es la venta de pollo por libas, Piedad paga arriendo por un cuarto en el que atiende a su clientela, Piedad solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos, huevos y algún otro producto que ofrece, Piedad tiene la aspiración de  seguir en su negocio y  que este sea mas productivo para dar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Piedad, 32, is divorced.  She has two children: a 17-year old boy and a 14-year old girl, both in school.   She has operated a business selling chickens, eggs, etc. for 5 years.  She operates the business in a rented space where she can meet her customers.  Piedad is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with the merchandise she sells.  For the future, she wants to carry on the business and ensure that it generates enough money to provide for her children and their schooling.

loans.use: to stock her chicken and eggs business.

loans.name: Evan

texts.en:
Evan is 36 years old, married with two children.

Evan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo, noodles, spices, etc.

Evan has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables and fish vending.

Evan aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Jellyn

texts.en:
Jellyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jellyn is 33 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Jellyn has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dry goods to sell like bags, slippers, umbrellas, etc.

Jellyn has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell like bags, slippers, umbrellas, etc.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 21 years old and married with one child.

She is in the agricultural business of poultry in the Philippines. Jenny is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jenny has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Meek Women - N2Thắngphúcnlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hiền is 35 years old and she is married with 2 children.
 
She has had a retail business selling general thing as cake, sugar, milk,...for 5 years.
Hiền lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Hiền faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake sugar, milk,... to resell.
In 2012, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hiền has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the group leader of the 02 Thắng Phúc, Ngư Lộc, which consists of 3 members.
With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sugar, milk,... to resell

loans.name: Thuật

texts.en:
Mrs Thuật is 33 years old and she is married.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 4 years. Thuật lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2015, Thuật joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Thuật has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Thuật hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a home products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of home products to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like clothing retail business.

Margarita dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of home products to sell.

loans.name: Darlinda

texts.en:
Darlinda is 59 years old and has six children. Darlinda is married and has two children are currently in school.

Darlinda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Darlinda requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Darlinda has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Maria Melany

texts.es:
María, actualmente está soltera, vive en compañía de sus hijos, su actividad económica es la siembra de maíz y frijol, con las cosechas abastece a su familia de alimento y otra parte lo comercializa para generar ingresos, tiene una experiencia de más de 20 años, es un oficio que heredó de su familia, trabaja de seis de la maña a una de la tarde. Por su experiencia no representa dificultades para mantenerse trabajando.
Solicita un crédito para llevar acabo la siembra de esta temporada, comprara insumos agrícolas para preparar el terreno en que realiza la siembra de granos básicos, así mismo podrá eliminar maleza y plagas que afecten sus cultivos, espera tener una cosecha abundante que le permita satisfacer a su familia y a sus clientes.
Las aspiraciones que ella tiene  son ampliar su vivienda y establecer otro tipo de negocio para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
María is currently single.  She lives with her children and earns a living growing maize and beans.  Part of what she harvests goes to feed her family and the rest is sold for cash.  María learned to farm as a girl and has made her living from farming for more than 20 years.  She works from 6:00am to 1:00pm.  She is used to the work and says that it is not difficult for her.  
María is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs for her next crop.  The investment will allow her to prepare her land for sowing and buy the supplies she needs to maximize her yields.  She hopes to harvest enough to cover the needs of both her family and her commercial buyers. 
For the future, María wants to expand her house and set up a second business that would generate an extra income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her next crop.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, agradece tanto a la institución como a Kiva por el apoyo que le dan con los créditos que solicita, comenta que ha podido cumplir con todos los contratos que tenía en su momento, su situación financiera es muy favorable para subsistir con su familia, hasta la fecha presenta buen estado de salud y estabilidad en el negocio.
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar telas, flores, pegamento, papelería, entre otros productos que son necesarios para continuar ofreciendo sus servicios de decoraciones, está convencido que de esta manera podrá tener su inventario surtido para satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luis is as grateful for the institution as he is for Kiva, because of the support they have given him with his loans. He mentions that he has been able to abide by all the contracts he has had. His financial situation is very favorable to support his family. So far, he is in good health and his business is stable.

He is requesting a new loan to buy fabric, glue, paper, and other products that are necessary to continue offering his decoration services. He is convinced that this will allow him to stock his inventory to satisfy his customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy fabric, flowers, glue, paper, and other products that are necessary to continue offering his decoration services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned food, cooking oil, detergent, milled rice, coconut, and sugar for her store.

loans.name: Fakhri

texts.en:
Fakhri is a 21-years-old single man from Deir Al-balah city, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely covers all the family needs. However, he wants to improve his family standard of living help them live more comfortably.

Fakhri took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system and filter for heating and cleaning water for the family house. By taking this loan, Fakhri will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also to decreasing the electricity expenses.
Fakhri appears in the photo

loans.use: in order to buy a solar system and filter for heating and cleaning water for the family house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more kiosk stock such as rice, and kerosene

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Noeme dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

Tessie has been raising pig  for 3 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 64 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, biscuits, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Vicenta has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Vicenta would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, biscuits, shampoo, etc. to sell

This income is barely covers all the family needs. However, he wants to improve his family standard of living help them live more comfortably.

Na'el took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system for heating  water for the family house. By taking this loan, Na'el will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also to decreasing the electricity expenses.
Na'el appears in the photo

loans.use: in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Manelyn

texts.en:
Manelyn is 24 years old from Moalboal, Cebu. She is married with two children ages one and eight. 

Manelyn is engaged in selling souvenir items like bangles, necklace made from pearls, native fans, bags, wallets, and handkerchiefs. This business continues to thrive because Moalboal is near the beach. She is asking a loan of 8000 PHP to buy more stocks of items such as wallets, native fans, handkerchiefs, and other accessories. 

Manelyn hope to expand her business so that she will be better equipped in meeting the needs of her children when they are older. In the future, she hopes to buy a house and lot for additional business.

loans.use: to buy wallets, native fans, handkerchiefs, and accessories.

loans.name: Cường

Cường  has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 4 years. He lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
His family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns his is the latrine is not hygienic, but his income is not enough to build a new toilet. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

In 2015, Cường joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve his  business. Cường has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With his business profit, Cường hopes for his business to do well, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

loans.name: Alma

Alma has a watch and cellphone repair business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for  watches and cellphone.

Alma has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for watches and cellphone repairs

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Bernarda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell sea foods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Bernarda is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy crabs, shrimp, oyster to sell to her customers.

Bernarda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy crabs, shrimp, oyster to sell to her customers

loans.name: Dianita

texts.en:
Dianita is 32 years old and has four children. Dianita is married and has three children are still in school.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana lives in Dili and her business is Restaurant food. She lives near as many people, so she has one idea to open restaurant for every body to come eat in her restaurant. She is earning a good income every day because many people come to eat in her restaurant so she is very happy with her business. 

And now she is applying for a loan of $ 800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business because she wants to open a bigger restaurant in the future. She opened her restaurant in 2007 with her own working capital of $100.00. 

She is taking this loan because she wants used to buy more materials such as rice, beef, pork, fish, chicken, herbs, eggs, instant noodles and other materials for the restaurant. She hopes with this loan, her business can be improving in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, beef, pork, fish, chicken, eggs, herbs, instant noodles and other materials.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 41-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the Refugee Camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Imad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will . This loan will help enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Imad Will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Neal’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Imad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Arlyn has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Arlyn wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawthar is a 49-years-old married woman from a village near Nablus city. She is a mother for one son and one daughter.  Her husband is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Six years ago, Kawthar opened a clothing store in the village. She sells women and kids clothing. It is a good business and the demand is high

Kawthar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new collection of women clothing to resell. This will increase her sales and also her income. 
Kawthar appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women clothing to resell

loans.name: Diana Mae

texts.en:
Diana Mae is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Diana Mae is 25 years old and has two children who are in school.

Diana Mae has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Diana Mae has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ma. Connie

texts.en:
Ma. Connie is 49 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Ma. Connie works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Connie runs a generals store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like coconut wine, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Ma. Connie has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as junk foods, coffee, shampoo, tuba, softdrinks, can goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Connie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like coconut wine, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries

Editha has been in this business for 31 years and sells a variety of items such as . 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, eggs, cooking oil, milk, drinks, spices

Johuana Marie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Johuana Marie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Johuana Marie has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Hương

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic, but she has not enough money to build a new one. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

In 2015, Hương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, coffee, soft-drinks, beers, candies, detergent soap, etc.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 55 years old, married with nine children.

Ludivina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Ludivina has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ludivina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in shirts, dresses, pants, as well as materials to make costume jewelry.

Merily has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic, but her income is not enough to build a new one. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

In 2015, Lan joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Lan has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

Ma.Luisa is 49 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Ma.Luisa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma.Luisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma.Luisa would like to save money to expand her business.

Erlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Arlene dreams that one day she will be able to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de ella, su negocio es la fabricación de ladrillo, aprendió a desarrollar dicha actividad cuando trabajaba como ayudante, posteriormente con la experiencia necesaria emprendió su propio negocio, ya tiene 5 años de poseerlo y da empleo a 4 personas.
 Ha solicitado un crédito para comprar barro, tierra madera, etc., para fabricar ladrillos y ampliar el horno en el que quema su producto, la finalidad que tiene al invertir en su negocio es aumentar la productividad del negocio para abastecer a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.
Los sueños de José son cancelar sus deudas y mejorar la situación económica para darle un mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and her three children. His business is making bricks. He learned how to do this work when he worked as an assistant. Subsequently, with the necessary experience, he started his own business. He has had it for 5 years and it employs 4 people.

He has asked for a loan in order to buy clay, mud, wood, etc. to make bricks and enlarge the oven in which he fires his product. His goal in investing in his business is to increase its productivity in order to supply his customers and increase his profits.

José dreams of paying his debts and improving the economic situation to provide greater well-being to his family.

loans.use: to buy clay, mud, wood, etc. to make bricks and to enlarge the oven in which he fires his product

loans.name: Diego De Jesus

texts.es:
Él es Diego es un empresario de 47 años de edad, una persona dedicada a la agricultura y la cría de cerdos, negocios que heredó de sus padres y que le han servido para mantener su hogar y nada más. 

Pero ahora gracias a la inclusión de Interactuar en su zona residencial, diego puede aspirar a mejores ingresos que le permitan no solo mantener su familia, sino también crecer, expandir sus terrenos, tener clientes constantes que paguen un precio justo por su arduo trabajo.

Es por ello que ahora quiere solicitar tu apoyo, un pequeño monto de capital que usará en la compra de cerdos y abonos para sus cultivos.

Diego se siente muy motivado ya que con el apoyo de interactuar está creando lazos con otros empresarios para comercializar sus productos rápidamente.
texts.en:
Diego is a 47-year-old businessman. He is a farmer and raises pigs, businesses that he inherited from his parents and which have served to support his home and nothing more.

But now, thanks to the inclusion of Interactuar in his residential area, Diego can aspire to better earnings that will allow him not only to support his family, but also to grow, to expand his land, and to have constant customers who will pay a fair price for his arduous work.

That is why he is now asking for your help, a small amount of capital that he will use to buy pigs and manure for his crops.

Diego is very motivated, since with the support of Interactuar he is creating ties with other businesspeople to sell his products quickly.

loans.use: to buy pigs and manure for his crops

loans.name: Marina Abigail

texts.es: Marina, una señora de  45 años de edad, desde muy pequeña creció en el campo, en la actualidad es madre soltera, tiene  una hija de 23 años, otra de 21 y el menor de  19 años; Marina trabaja en la  agricultura haciendo pequeños huertos de los productos que se dan en su localidad, así como son papa, frejol, arveja, entre otros. Marina solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de abono y fungicidas para tener sus cultivos sanos. Marina comenta que mediante la agricultura ha sacado adelante a sus hijos, ella espera seguir teniendo buenas cosechas y que sus ingresos sean mayores para mejorar la calidad de vida junto a sus hijos.
texts.en: Marina, 45 years old, has lived in the country since she was very little. Today she is a single mother; she has a 23-year-old daughter, a 21-year-old daughter, and her youngest is a 19-year-old son. Marina works in agriculture with small fields of products that are typical in her region, such as potatoes, beans, peas, and others. Marina is requesting the loan to purchase fertilizer and fungicide to keep her crops healthy. Marina says that through agriculture she has supported her children. She hopes that she continues to have good harvests and that her income increases to improve the quality of life for her and her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fungicide.

loans.name: Rubina Group

texts.en:
Rubina is a 38 old married woman.She is a mother of a son and a daughter. Her financially condition is not good. Her husband has been driving his moto rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Its body made by polyester which is not enough strong to take the jerks of the roads. 

Now the rickshaw body is need to be replaced because it has rattled during driving. This is the reason her husband wants to buy new body for Moto Rickshaw.
Rubina requested a loan so that her husband can buy a new rickshaw body so that he could drive it smoothly.

Rubina pays thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to use this loan for her husband to repair his auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 25-year-old single man from Khan Younis. He is very ambitious. 

A few years ago, he opened a store for distributing internet services for the citizens in Khan Younis. His business is very successful and profitable, so he wants to expand it.

Marwan took a loan from FATEN to help him buy more PCs and other electronics that he uses in his business. By taking this loan, Marwan will be able to serve more clients and also hire employees. 

Marwan appears in the photo while he is working.

loans.use: to buy more PCs and other electronics that he uses in his business.

loans.name: Divinagracia

texts.en:
Divinagracia is 62 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell dry goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell.

Divinagracia has been in this business for 30 years. 

In the future Divinagracia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is 54 years old and has eight children.  Melodia is married and has eight children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Melodia requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Melodia has been farming sugarcane for 13 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melodia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is 50 years old, married with ten children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

Genoveva has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia works hard to support her family. Herminia is married and has a buy and sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of herbal medicine to sell.

Herminia has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Herminia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Ryskan

texts.ru: Рыскан, 45 лет, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. У нее высшее образование, 25 лет работает в школе учителем, ежемесячная заработная плата составляет 7,200 сом (KGS). Рыскан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для проведения ремонта дома. Доходы от кредита Рыскан планирует вложить в дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Ryskan is 45 years old, married, and raising four children. She has a higher education. She has worked for 25 years as a school teacher. Her monthly salary is 7,200 som (KGS). Ryskan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy construction materials to carry out renovations of her house. Ryskan plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to renovate her house.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru: Майрам, 50 лет, не замужем, 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, она спокойная, любезная и трудолюбивая. Майрам занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 4 коровы, 2 овцы, на 0,68 Га арендованной и 0,45 Га собственной земли выращивает кукурузу и клевер. Ежемесячный доход около 11,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов, а именно шифера, кирпичей, дверей и окон для постройки дома и сараев для скота. Доходы от бизнеса она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Mairam is 50 years old, unmarried, and has three children. She has a secondary education. She is calm, kind, and hard-working. Mairam is a farmer. Today she has four cows and two sheep, and she grows corn and clover on 0.68 hectares of rented and 0.45 hectares of her own land. Her monthly income is about 11,000 som (KGS). She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy construction materials, specifically slate, bricks, doors and windows to build a house and livestock barns. She will invest the proceeds of her business in its future development and in improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to finish building her house and livestock barns.

loans.name: Johanna Mishell

texts.es: Mishell, una joven con muchas aspiraciones para su futuro, Mishell vive con sus padres y hermanos, Mishell es la mayor de los 4 hermanos, ella termino el bachillerato y no continuo estudiando, Mishell se dedica a trabajar al jornal en trabajos de campo y al cuidado  de animales menores. Mishell  solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos para tenerlos en galpones construidos por ella misma, Mishell espera mejorar su negocio y seguir trabajando para tratar de mejorar la calidad de vida junto a su familia y sobre todo que sus hermanos tengan la oportunidad de seguir  estudiando.
texts.en:
Mishell is a young woman with a lot of hopes for the future. She lives with her parents and her siblings and is the oldest of the 4 siblings. She finished her high school diploma and did not continue with her education. She makes a living working as a day labourer doing farm tasks and looking after small animals. 

Mishell is asking for the money from the loan to invest in buying chickens to keep in sheds she has built herself. She hopes to improve her business and continue working to try to improve her own and her family's quality of life. Above all she hope her siblings have the opportunity to continue their education.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria started her business in 2001, with her own working capital of $350.00. Maria is married and it is a home based business . She is requesting a loan of $1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more plastic bottles to put water in for selling. 

She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can improve her business and her management.

loans.use: To buy plastic bottles to put water in for selling

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala es una señora de 50 años, vive en una comunidad del caserio Pochol, junto a su esposo, ella no tiene hijos.
Pascuala es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia y muy comprometida, en ayudar a su esposo para generar sus ingresos y así contribuir en los gastos de la casa, para poder sacar adelante a su familia, Pascuala desde muy pequeña creció y trabajo al lado de su mamá y heredo el oficio con que su mama apoyaba a su familia, ella ahora se dedica a la venta de banano, que en su región se produce.
Ella desde hace varios años,  ha tenido el anhelo de construir una casa más digna para su familia, por tal motivo solicita un crédito para apoyar a su esposo con la construcción de su casa, y contar con un hogar más cómoda, ella comprara con el crédito materiales como: cemento, block, hierro. Y con las ganancias que genere de su pequeño negocio ella estaría pagando el préstamo. Pascuala es una mujer muy trabajadora y ella tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito y su sueño es ver su casa desde otra perspectiva. También sueña comprar más terreno.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a 50-year-old woman. She lives in a community in the village of Pochol with her husband. She does not have children.

Pascuala is a woman who is very dedicated to her family and very committed to helping her husband to generate income and contribute in this way towards the household expenses in order to be able to move her family forward. Since she was very young, Pascuala grew and worked alongside her mother and inherited the work with which her mother supported her family. She now sells bananas, which are produced in her region.

For several years, she has had the desire to build a more dignified house for her family. For this reason, she is asking for a loan to support her husband with the construction of her house and to have a more comfortable home. With the loan, she will buy materials like cement, blocks, and iron. And with the profits she generates from her small business, she will be paying back the loan. Pascuala is a very hard-working woman and she hopes to get the loan and her dream is to see her house from another perspective. She also dreams of buying more land.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, blocks, and iron

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 40 years and a mother of three children. Her husband has been working as vehicle mechanic for 25 years, her husband is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage the house hold. 

Nargis's husband wants to buy machinery and other tools for his business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means her husband cannot afford to buy these merchandises. 

Therefore Nargis has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. with the help of this loan her husband can purchase the relevant items for his business purpose and earn profitable income to meet the daily needs of family and business.

Nargis is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband to increase his vehicle mechanic and repair business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 37 years old, is married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lolita has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 57 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Nena is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

Nena has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, sugar, etc for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Daisy Mae

texts.en:
Daisy Mae is 29 years old and married with one child, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell .

Daisy Mae has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future Daisy Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a buy and sell flowers business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of flowers to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of flowers to sell

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar aditivos, lubricantes y aceites,  para atender mejor las necesidades de sus clientes y seguir mejorando su situación económica.
Con el crédito anterior mejoro en gran manera su negocio, el servicio que ofrece a sus clientes es más eficaz y con los nuevos ingresos ha cancelado su deuda y mejorado su vivienda.
texts.en: Juan needs a new loan to buy additives, lubricants and oil, so he can meet his customers' needs better and continue to improve his financial situation. With the previous loan he improved his business a great deal. The service he offers his customers is more efficient and with the new income he has paid off his loan and improved his home.

loans.use: to buy additives, lubricants and oil, in order to meet his customers' needs better.

loans.name: Orozbubu

texts.ru: Орозбубу, 58 лет, замужем, 6 детей. Образование- среднее. Орозбубу занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря своей трепетной работе и ответственности, она на сегодняшний день имеет хорошее хозяйство: 5 коров, 20 овец, а также обрабатывает 4,0 ГА поливной земли, на которой она ежегодно сажает люцерну. Ежемесячная прибыль ее семьи составляет около 21,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Орозбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Орозбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса и покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Orozbubu is 58 years old, married, and has six children. She has a secondary education. Orozbubu rears animals and grows crops. Thanks to her careful work and responsibility, today she has a good farm: five cows and 20 sheep, and she also cultivates 4.0 hectares of irrigated land on which she plants alfalfa each year. Her family's monthly profit is about 21,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Orozbubu has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock to increase her herd. Orozbubu plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further expansion of her business and buying furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota has been involved in food production activities since 2005. She started her business with her own working capital of $100.00. Carlota is married. She is a business women and her business is selling fried. 

So she is requesting a loan of $1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants use to buy more materials, including  wheat, cooking oils, sauce, chili and other materials to use. She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can improving her business and also her income can be increased.

loans.use: To buy wheat, cooking oils, sauce, chili and other materials to use.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 45 years old woman, and mother of 1 child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is milk seller by profession.

Kalsoom's husband needs to buy milk for reselling purpose so that her husband can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase milk for his business purpose.

Therefore Kalsoom has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's milk business

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a 24-years-old single young man from Khan Younis. He is a very ambitious man. 
A few years ago, he started raising poultry in a small barn next to his house. Now he sells meat and eggs in the local market.

Tareq took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more chicks and feeds for his business. By taking this loan, Tareq will be able to increase his productivity and also his sales.
Tareq appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feeds for his business.

loans.name: Busazhida

texts.ru: Бусажида, 60 лет, замужем, мать героиня 8 детей. Образование-среднее, она на пенсии. С 1995 года Бусажида занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве есть корова, овца. Ежемесячная прибыль Бусажиды составляет 19,000 сом (KGS). Она решила развить свою сельскохозяйственную деятельность, так как это единственный источник доходов и обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от бизнеса она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства, чтобы накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Busazhida is 60 years old, married, and the heroic mother of eight children. She has a secondary education. She is retired. Busazhida has been rearing animals since 1995. She has a cow and a sheep. Busazhida's monthly profit is 19,000 som (KGS). She has decided to develop her agricultural business since it is her sole source of income and she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows to increase the size of her herd. She will invest the proceeds from the business in the further development of her farm in order to save up to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Anafe

texts.en:
Anafe is 43 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

Anafe has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her restaurant business.

Eden has been in this business for 5 years. Eden earns more income from fishing.

Eden has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 17 years. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good.  It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Naseem has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Naseem's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Naseem  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Naseem is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es:
Siempre hay motivo para sonreír, pero, hoy el señor Sergio tiene un motivo gigante y es que está a tan solo un paso de poder iniciar un negocio propio, un restaurante  que significara el comienzo de una nueva vida para él, su pareja y su hija de tan solo 2 meses de edad.

Sergio quiso tomar la decisión de convertirse en independiente ya que en su trabajo anterior no podía sostener a su familia y quería construir un hogar y pondrá todo su empeño y ganas para hacer de su restaurante todo un éxito.

Con el dinero que logro ahorrar, compro algunos materiales, equipos e incluso pago por adelantando un local, pero no le alcanzo para comprar lo suficiente para su negocio, es por ello, que desea solicitar un préstamo para la compra de; mesas, sillas, un fogón, horno, barra, vajilla y licuadora industrial, insumos restantes para poder abrir su negocio y luchar por cumplir sus sueños de comprar vivienda y vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
There is always a reason to smile, but today Sergio has a gigantic reason, and it is that he is only one step away from being able to start his own business, a restaurant. This will mean the beginning of a new life for him, his partner, and his daughter, who is only 2 months old.

Sergio wanted to make the decision to become independent, since at his previous job he could not support his family, and he wanted to buy a house and will put all his determination and desire into making his restaurant a great success.

With the money that he was able to save, he bought some materials and equipment and even made an advance payment for his premises, but it was not sufficient to buy enough for his business. That is why he wants a loan to buy tables, chairs, a stove, an oven, a counter, silverware, and an industrial blender, the remaining supplies for him to be able to open his business and fight to achieve his dreams of buying a house and living comfortably.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, a stove, an oven, a counter, silverware, and an industrial blender

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for use in his farm so as to get more farm produce for sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Mohpora

texts.en:
