Mohpora is a clever girl. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1996 and now is living with her family, as she is divorced.  She is a second year student. She had a dream to be a teacher. She is an active, bright and helpful person and is popular among friends and students. 

She is thankful to IMON which offers a good opportunity to realize someone’s dream. She requested a loan to pay her higher education costs. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders' compassion.

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, etc.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, etc.

loans.name: Jose Amilcar

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa, no tienen hijos, tiene 30 años de vivir con su pareja; se dedica a realizar actividades agrícolas para tener ingresos con los que puede cubrir todas las necesidades familiares, los principales cultivos que desarrolla son de maíz y yuca, además vende frutas por temporadas, ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y es reconocido en su localidad por el tipo de negocio que posee.
Ya ha sembrado pero necesita de un crédito para comprar de inmediato insecticidas, abono y plaguicidas, para darle un buen desarrollo a sus cultivos y tener una cosecha abundante, espera vender sus productos a mejores precios para estabilizarse económicamente.
Las aspiraciones que él tiene es ser reconocido en su comunidad como una persona de bien, trabajadora y responsable en cubrir las necesidades que surgen en su hogar.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife, they have no children, and have lived together for thirty years. He works in agriculture to earn income to cover all their household expenses. His main crops are corn and yuca, he also sells seasonal fruits. By now he has a great deal of experience, and is known throughout the area for his business. 
He has already planted his crops, but he needs a loan immediately to buy insecticides, fertilizer and pest controls, to help his crops grow well and have an abundant harvest. He hopes to sell his products at better prices and have more stable finances. 
His aspirations are to be recognized in his community as a good, hard-working person, responsible for covering all the necessities that may arise in his home.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizer and pest controls, to raise healthy crops and have an abundant harvest

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a repeat client at Ugafode microfinance ltd. She is a married woman with children. 

Edith is a business woman raising chickens at home. In a bid to increase on her working capital and expand on the business, she has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000. This will be used to buy chicken feeds that will help to increase the size of her chickens and also yield better quality meat. In her business she is  faced with a challenge of competition and lack of enough capital.

Edith is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.  She is hard working and honest. She appreciates the UGAFODE services and support of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy chicken feed

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is 55 years old woman and mother of 8 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall, her husband sells different types of eatable items e.g samosa, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, Kabab paratha and etc. 

Khalida's husband needs to purchase different types of eatable and other items for his business purpose so that her husband can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position her husband is not in condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.

Therefore Khalida has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's food stall business

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 51 год, вдова, есть 3 детей, вся семья с радостью помогает по хозяйству. Около 16 лет назад Динара стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, накопив на старт сумму в 6,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Динары, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 4 коровы, 10 овец, лошадь. Также на собственной земельной доле мерою 1,08 ГА она выращивает люцерну для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет всего около 11,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Динара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота. Динара является участником группы "Весна", всего в ней состоят 3 человека. Динара планирует и дальше расширять ее бизнес.
texts.en: Dinara is 51 years old, a widow, and has three children. All her family happily help her on the farm. Dinara started rearing animals and growing crops about 16 years ago, having saved up a sum of 6,000 som (KGS) to start. Thanks to Dinara's hard work, today she has four cows, ten sheep, and a horse. She also grows alfalfa for sale on a 1.08 hectare plot of her own land. Her monthly profit is just approximately 11,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Dinara has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy feed for her livestock. Dinara is a member of the "Vesna" [Spring] group which comprises three peopel. Dinara plans to keep expanding her business in future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Frankin

texts.es:
Frankin es un hombre de 38 años de edad, se dedica a la cría de cerdos, una persona respetuosa con gran sentido de responsabilidad que día a día trabaja por mejorar su situación económica.

Es padre de 2 hijos la menor de 1 año y el mayor de 4, y aunque se separó de su pareja sigue velando por el cuidado de sus pequeños.

La separación con su pareja ha significado un fuerte cambio económico en su vida, ya que tiene que velar por dos hogares, el suyo y él de sus pequeños.

Es por ello que en vista de esta situación Frankin desea solicitar un apoyo económico para mejorar su productividad y capacidad de su negocio. 

El dinero será invertido de la siguiente manera:
•	Una parte estará destinada al pago de un crédito anterior, desea quedar pagando solo una deuda.
•	El restante será para la compra de una cerda de cría y construcción de un chiquero.
Su propósito es ser un éxito empresario, tener dinero para vivir cómodamente y pagar la educación y solventar las necesidades de sus hijos
texts.en:
Frankin is 38 years old and makes a living raising pigs. He is a respectful person with a great sense of responsibility who works every day to improve his financial situation. He is the father of 2 children, a one-year-old girl and a boy of 4. Although he separated from his partner he is still concerned about looking after his children. The separation from his partner has meant a major financial change in his life, as he now has to look after two households: his own and his children's. 

In view of this situation Frankin wants to ask for financial support to improve his productivity and his business capacity. The money will be used in the following way:
•One part will be used to pay off a previous loan; he wants to be left with only one debt to pay.
•The rest will be used to buy a breeding sow and to build a pigsty. His aim is to be a successful businessman, to have enough money to live comfortably and to pay for the education and provide for the needs of his children.

loans.use: to pay off a previous loan and to buy a breeding sow and build a pigsty.

loans.name: Taumainuumau

texts.en:
Taumainuumau is a 63 year old mother with 6 children and has a small business of growing and selling vegetables(cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. Taumainuumau requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her run the business. 

She hopes to expand her business by using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Venancio

texts.es: Venancio tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia a lado de su esposa y sus dos hijos de 17 y 13 años, además sus dos sobrinos de 13 y 10 años, hijos y sobrinos se dedican a estudiar. Venancio es un hombre que desde hace cinco años se dedica a la elaboración y reparación de muebles como: camas, mesas, silla,  pupitres, escritorios, etc., además con el propósito de obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan solventar los gastos de su vivienda también se dedica a la venta de lácteos y embutidos en su casa de habitación. Venancio con el deseo de suparación en su negocio a tomado la decisión de adquirir un crédito en FUSAI para poder invertir en la compra de materiales para la carpintería  y productos comestibles para su negocio como son: madera, clavos, tornillos, pinturas, etc., además comprar crema, queso, chorizos, salchichas, etc., para su venta de lácteos y embutidos, para poder cumplir con la demanda de productos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Venancio is 42 years old. He lives in his own house along with his wife and their two children aged 17 and 13 years, as well as his two nephews aged 13 and 10 years. The children all go to school. Venancio is a man who has worked for five years making and repairing furniture such as beds, tables, chairs, desks, bureaux etc. In addition to this he also makes a living selling dairy products and cold meats from his home with the aim of making a larger income which will allow him to cover his household expenses.

With the desire to improve in his business Venancio has taken the decision to take on a loan from FUSAI so he can invest in buying materials for the carpentry business and foodstuffs for his other business. He will buy items such as wood, nails, screws, paints as well as cream, cheese, chorizo, sausages etc. for his business selling dairy products and cold meats, so he can meet his customers' demands for products.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, screw and paint for his carpentry business and also buy cream, cheese, chorizo, sausages etc. for his business selling dairy products and cold meats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, gravel, a toilet, etc., to start the construction of a lavatory as soon as possible

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 28 years old and supports 2 children. She has been selling french fries, or "chips," to clients for the last 9 years. The business earns her 5,000 KES per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase additional sacks of potatoes and extra jars of cooking oil as business stock, thus attracting more customers to her french fries market. 

Teresa plans to use the profits to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production, so as to enable her supply milk to clients and educate her children. 

Her hope is to expand her business sector and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of potatoes and extra jars of cooking oil as business stock.

loans.name: Lany

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lany works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell at the market via her fish vending business.

Lany has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell at the market

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman, 55 years old, with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy equipment for fishing, like fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

Lucia has been in this business for four years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for fishing, like fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 27 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, etc.

Marivic has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell natural medicines business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing.  Elena is borrowing PHP 21000 through NWTF to  purchase more stocks of bottles to sell for her buy and sell natural medicines business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of natural medicines to sell

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika is 27 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like detergent soap, shampoo, milk, coffee, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Erika has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like detergent soap, shampoo, milk, coffee, sugar, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Umuseke Sub Group A

texts.en:
UMUSEKE is a group led by Vestine who is 32 years old. The group name means “THE LIGHT. She has been a group leader for one year.

Vestine sells clothes and has been selling in a business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts and dresses to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy medical insurance and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and dresses to sell..

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase 85 cases of Primus pale lager

loans.name: Dodaroi

texts.en:
Dodaroi is a careful mother. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1962. She is widow and has one child. She is the director of a school. She studied chemistry-biology and has 11 years of practice teaching students and working at a school. After her husband death, she raised her son alone. 

Her son studies at university. Dodaroi has not enough money to pay her son’s higher education costs. She appealed to IMON and KIVA asking a loan to pay her son’s tuition fee in chemistry. She hopes to be understood and supported.

loans.use: to pay son’s tuition fees in chemistry

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
Karen es una mujer de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 2 meses y 3 años, y su negocio es la manicura.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, dinámica, contante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la zona ‘mutualista’  un área céntrica y comercial, edificios de oficinas públicas y privadas conviven lado a lado. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Karen es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (a la izquierda, viste calza blanca y sostiene a su bebé). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar. Viven en un cuarto alquilado construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Debido a la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos formó una banca de emprendimiento con 8 socios que se dedican a; carpintería, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, artesanía en cerámica, venta de productos naturales para la salud, elaboración de sombreros de sao y venta de jugos, para solicita run crédito y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la manicura; ella se dedica al cuidado y embellecimiento de las manos y en especial del tratamiento y pintura de las uñas, sus horarios son de forma independiente en centros de estética y peluquerías, sus ocupaciones son; el corte, limpieza y pulido de las uñas de las clientas tanto de las manos como de los pies, “trabajo de forma ambulante, mayormente en oficinas, esta ocupación me deja tiempo para cuidar a mis hijos porque los horarios son flexibles…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para alquilar un lugar fijo donde trabajar y cuidar a sus bebés. Su sueño es abrir su propio salón de belleza, ella desea alquilar un ambiente para instalar su lugar fijo de manicura y comprar algunos utensilios como; removedor de cutícula, Empujador para cutícula, Cortaúñas, Algodón, etc. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
 Es por esos motivos que Karen solicita un préstamo para alquilar un ambiente para instalar su puesto de manicura y también comprar utensilios de trabajo.
texts.en:
Karen is 24 years old and lives with her husband.  She has two children, ages 2 months and 3 years and she runs a manicure business.  She is a good, dynamic, trustworthy, responsible, and hardworking entrepreneur. She runs her business on foot in the ‘mutualistic’ zone, a central commercial area where public and private office buildings are located side by side. There’s a warm, sub-tropical climate with a daily temperature between 21 and 35 degrees.

Karen has brown skin, brown eyes, long black hair, with a robust complexion, and is of short stature. Guaraní is her mother tongue, which she speaks at home, and speaks Spanish culturally and in her business. (She is to the left of the image, wearing white and holding a baby.)  She shares her life with her husband, who works in transportation, and her children who are not yet of school age. They live in a rented brick and cement room, with a tin roof and a cement floor. It has electricity, running water, and sewage.  She formed an entrepreneur club with 8 people out of her need to improve her income, get a loan to improve her business. They are carpenters, sell food, second hand clothing, ceramic art, natural health products, juices, and make hats

She has a manicure business and provides hand care and nail polishing.  She sets her own hours in beauty and hair salons.  She provides haircuts, and finger and toe nail cleaning and polishing for her customers. She says, “I am a mobile worker, mostly in offices. This occupation allows me time to care for my children because the hours are flexible.”  The advantage she has in her business is that she has steady customers.  The disadvantage is that she needs capital to rent a fixed shop to work from and care for her babies. Her dream is to open her own beauty shop. She wants to rent a location so she can set up a fixed manicure site and buy some supplies such as cuticle remover liquid and sticks, nail clippers, cotton, etc. This will be her first loan through the institution during her two years in business.

Karen is asking for this loan to rent a space and buy work supplies.

loans.use: to rent a shop and buy supplies.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analyn works hard to support her family. She runs a business buying and selling root crops in the Philippines, and she also earns income from pig fattening.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF for her root crops business, in order to buy root crops to sell.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy root crops to sell

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 66 years old and married with three children. 

Angela is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Angela requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Angela has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Angela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita is 34 years old and married with five children, four in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more household goods to sell.

Erlita has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods to sell

loans.name: Coraley

texts.en:
Coraley is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Coraley is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Coraley has a buy and sell live stock business in the Philippines. Coraley requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more livestock and sell.

Coraley has been in this business for five years. In the future, Coraley would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Mary Vic

texts.en:
Mary Vic is 34 years old and married with two children, both of whom are presently in school. Mary Vic works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of different recycled materials to sell.

Mary Vic has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of different recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz is 49 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Flordeliz is borrowing PHP 11500 through NWTF to pay for laborers salaries for land preparation and buy fertilizers.

Flordeliz has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from gardening vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay laborers salaries for land preparation and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 53 years old and married with seven children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Concepcion has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Concepcion requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional rice to sell.

Concepcion has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Concepcion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell like noodles, cooking oil, spices, eggs, chips, bread, etc

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is 65 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Wilfreda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Wilfreda has been raising pigs for five years and earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Fátima es una joven emprendedora que ha logrado salir adelante a su corta edad. Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y el préstamo obtenido anteriormente ha logrado surtir su negocio con más productos. Para seguir creciendo en la venta de ropa y ofertar mayor variedad a sus clientes Fátima solicita otro crédito para comprar ropa interior. En un futuro no muy lejano Fátima planea tener un tramo con todas las condiciones y con mayor inventario de productos.
texts.en:
Fátima is a young entrepreneur who has managed to make progress at a young age. Thanks to the support of her husband and the loan she had previously she has managed to stock her business with more products. 

In order to continue growing in her sales of clothing and offer a larger variety to her customers, Fátima is asking for another loan to buy underwear. In the not-too-distant future she plans to have a fully equipped stall with a larger range of products.

loans.use: to buy underwear.

loans.name: Janith

texts.en:
Janith is 52 years old and has eight children.  Janith is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Janith requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seedling and fertilizers for her business.

Janith has been farming vegetables for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Janith would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedling and fertilizers for her business

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is 48 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and two children. Her husband has been running own tailoring shop in the local market for 13 years.

Shaheen's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable condition to buy these items for his business purpose. 

Therefore Shaheen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband obtain these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn more profitable income.

On this financial assistance Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas is applying for a loan of $ 1000.00.  She is married and has 3 children and her husband is also a business men, 

She is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including ring toys, children's toys, aqua, slippers, soft drinks and other things to sell.  She started her business in 2013 with a working capital of $400.00. 

She hopes to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her management.

loans.use: To buy ring toys, children's toys, aqua, slippers,soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 41-year-old married mother of six children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Cecilia has a general store business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy propane gas, firewood, corn, and lime [calcium hydroxide] so that she will have the raw materials necessary to continue producing tortillas and meeting the new demands of her customers.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a married woman with four children. Elenita is 51 years old and two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elenita has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Elenita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

In the future, Elenita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nurzat

texts.ru: Нурзат, 37 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей. С 2000 года Нурзат стала заниматься животноводством, накопив на старт сумму в 12,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Нурзат, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 5 коров, 30 овец, 3 лошади. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет всего около 17,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурзат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота. Нурзат является участником группы "Весна", всего в ней состоят 3 человека. Она планирует и дальше расширять бизнес и сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Nurzat is 37 years old, married, and has four children. Nurzat has been rearing animals since 2000, having saved up a sum of 12,000 som (KGS) to start. Thanks to Nurzat's hard work, today she has five cows, 30 sheep, and three horses. Her monthly profit is about 17,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Nurzat has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy feed for her livestock. Nurzat is a member of the "Vesna" [Spring] group which comprises three people in total. She plans to keep expanding her business and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.ru: Рахат, 39 лет, замужем, мать 4 сыновей. С 2002 года Рахат стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Рахат, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 5 коров, 8 овец, лошадь. На 1,8 Га земли выращивает люцерну для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет всего около 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рахат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота. Рахат является лидером группы "Весна", всего в которой состоят 3 человека. Она планирует и дальше расширять бизнес и накопить на завершение строительства дома.
texts.en: Rahat is 39 years old, married, and the mother of four sons. Rahat has been rearing animals and growing crops since 2002. Thanks to Rahat's hard work, today she has five cows, eight sheep, and a horse. She grows alfalfa for sale on 1.8 hectares of land. Her total monthly profit is about 12,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Rahat has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy feed for her livestock. Rahat is the leader of the "Vesna" [Spring] group which comprises three people in total. She plans to keep expanding her business and to save up to complete construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
José es un empresario de 41 años de edad, vive con su pareja con la cual tiene un negocio de cría de aves, que, les ha servido para generar los ingresos con los que llevan el alimento diario a su mesa.

Como empresario siempre aspira a engrandecer su negocio, vender todas sus existencias, pero ahora tiene un humilde deseo que le ha venido prometiendo a su esposa pero por la falta de recursos no ha logrado cumplir, dicho deseo  es mejorar las condiciones físicas de su hogar.

José se ha planteado una y otra vez como lograr este objetivo, entre sus opciones está solicitar un préstamo, pero es una persona inteligente y sabe que sino potencia su profesión no tendrá como pagar la deuda.

Ahora José con ayuda y asesorías ha tomado una decisión final la cual es solicitar un préstamo, pero, para mejorar su negocio, comprando pollos y alimento por bultos (al por mayor). Para minimizar gastos a largo plazo, mejorando sus ingresos, inventarios  y ventas, lo que le permitirá ir ahorrando para cumplir la promesa que le hizo un día a su esposa, aparte de que tendrán una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old and a business owner. He lives with his partner, with whom he owns a business for raising birds. This business has brought them the income that allowed them to put food on the table. 

As an entrepreneur, he is always looking to enlarge his business and sell his product, but right now he has the humble desire to improve the physical conditions in his home. This is something that he has promised his wife, but hasn't been able to do due to the lack of resources. 

José has thought about how to complete his goal, and one of his options is to take out a loan, but he is an intelligent person and knows that if he isn't strong in his profession, he won't be able to pay back the debt. 

Now, through support and advice, José has made the final decision to request a loan to improve his business by buying chickens and feed in bulk. This is so he'll be able to minimize expenses in the long-term, which will improve his income, inventory, and sales. This will allow him to save money so that he can keep the promise he made to his wife and allow them both to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed in large quantities to minimize expenses in the long-term

loans.name: Leone

texts.en: Leone is a 49 year old mother with 7 children, she runs a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Leone requested for a loan to buy a box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags, to assist her run the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags,

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Va is a 34-year-old mother with one child. She runs a business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living.

Va requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei design, containers, and a printing machine to assist her in running the business.

She has been doing this for more than a year. She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei design, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru:
На фотографии Хасан и его мама. Хасан молодой и ответственный мужчина аз района Хамадони. Он строитель. Хасан живет вместе с мамой, женой и двумя детьми. Его старшей дочке 5 лет, а сыну 2 года. В основном воспитанием детей занимается мама Хасана. 
  До сегодняшнего дня мама Хасана не работала, но имела большой талант в области шитья. Она сама шила себе платье и родным тоже, бесплатно. Но из-за того что ее старая машинка (на фотографии) сломалась, мама Хасана больше не могла продолжить шить. Новая швейная машинка стоить дорого и их семья не могла позволить себе купить машинку. Хасан понимает, что шить и кроить одежду для его мамы очень важное место занимает в жизни и решил сделать для нее подарок. Он обратился за финансовой поддержкой, чтобы купить маме новую швейную машинку. Хасан будет признателен, если его поддержат.
texts.en:
In the photograph are Hasan and his mother. Hasan is a young and responsible man from the Hamadoni region. He is a builder. Hasan lives with his mother, wife, and two children. His eldest daughter is five years old, and his son is two years old. Hasan's mother mainly looks after the children.

Until now, Hasan's mother has not worked, but she has had a great talent for sewing. She has sewn dresses for herself and for her relatives, for free. But Hasan's mother has not been able to continue sewing because her old sewing machine (in the photograph) has broken. A new sewing machine is expensive and their family has not been able to afford one. Hasan understands that cutting and sewing occupy a very important place in his mother's life, and he has decided to give her a present. He has applied for financial support in buying his mother a new sewing machine. Hasan will be grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for his mother.

loans.name: Moliqob

texts.ru: Ее зовут Моликоб. Ей 46 лет. Она мать одиночка из маленького и дальнего района под названием Темурмалик. Она одна поднимает своих детей на ноги и старается, чтобы они не в чем не нуждались. Моликоб занимается животноводством. Она покупает маленьких телят, откармливает и после продает их с наценкой. Сейчас у нее не большое количество скот и она хочет приобрести еще пару голов, расширить деятельности и увеличить доходность. Моликоб не в состоянии самостоятельно совершить операцию и она просит помочь ей.
texts.en: This lady is called Moliqob. She is 46 years old. She is a single mother from a small and distant region called Temurmalik. She is raising her children on her own and strives to ensure that they do not want for anything. Moliqob rears animals. She buys young calves, fattens them up, and then sells them on at a profit. Now she has just a few cattle and she wants to acquire another couple of calves, to expand her business and to increase its profitability. Moliqob is unable to carry this out by herself, and she is asking for help.

loans.use: to buy a couple of calves.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Мохира замужняя женщина из района Бохтар. Ей 34 года. Мохира с мужем занимаются животноводством и земледелием. В свободное время ее муж предоставляет услуги такси. На районах таксисты за 5-10 км берут примерно $0,5 - 1$. На районах отсутствуют маршрутки и автобусы. Жители пользуются только легковыми автомобилями.
  Сейчас автомобиль ее мужа нуждается в ремонте. Мохира сама обратилась за кредитом, потому что МДО "Хумо" упрощает процесс кредитования для женщин. Благодаря кредиту ее муж сможет отремонтировать машину и продолжить предоставлять услуги таксиста.
texts.en:
Mohira is a married woman from the Bohtar region. She is 34 years old. Mohira and her husband rear animals and grow crops. In his spare time her husband provides a taxi service. In these areas taxi drivers take about $0.50 - $1 to go 5-10 kilometres. There are no fixed-route taxi vans or buses in these parts. The residents use only cars.

At the present time her husband's car needs to be repaired. Mohira has applied for a loan herself, because MLO Humo simplifies the loan process for women. Thanks to the loan, her husband will be able to fix his car and continue to offer a taxi service.

loans.use: to repair her husband's car.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is married and has six children. For the past ten years she has earned a living by running a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines. She earns additional income from food vending.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from Kiva's field partner NWTF. She successfully repaid a previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan of 23,000 PHP to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell from her store and further build her business.

Liezel is working hard to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy material for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Marissa has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy material for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her business.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: Blanca a sus 43 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos asisten al colegio, Blanca y su esposo trabajan al jornal en la agricultura. Blanca también se dedica a criar animales menores, Blanca solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de cuyes, Blanca comenta que los ingresos económicos los obtiene de la crianza  de animales y del jornal y que es así como saca adelante sus hijos, la mayor aspiración de Blanca es que su negocio sea cada vez mas rentable para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca, 43 years old, is married and has 4 children, 3 of which are in school. Blanca and her husband work as agricultural day laborers. Blanca also works raising young animals. 

Blanca requests the money from this loan to invest in buying guinea pigs. Blanca notes that she obtains her income from raising animals and from day labor and that is how she moves her children forward. Blanca’s greatest goal is for her business to become increasingly profitable in order to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Greisy Tatiana

texts.es: Tatiana, una chica de 21 años de edad, se encuentra estudiando y para pagar sus estudios se dedica a su negocio que es el de venta de productos naturistas, alimenticios y de salud. Tatiana solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de  mercadería en los productos que ofrece para que su negocio sea más rentable, Tatiana se dedica 3 años a este negocio de venta de productos por catalogo, ella vive  junto a su madre y las 2 aspiran que Tatiana logre terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Tatiana, a 21-year-old young woman, is currently studying. To pay for her education, she runs a business selling natural foods and health products. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of the merchandise that she offers so that her business will be more profitable.

Tatiana has worked in this business for three years, selling products from a catalog. She lives with her mother, and their aspiration is for Tatiana to be able to complete her education.

loans.use: to buy health products

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is single and has an internet café business in the Philippines.

Roberto requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF in order to buy new computer supplies for his internet café.

He has been in this business for nine year.

In the future, Roberto would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy new computer supplies for his internet café.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 35 years old, married and works hard to help her husband.

She has a seaweeds cultured business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing.  Ligaya is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to  purchase additional seaweeds seedling and plastic rope for her seaweeds cultured business.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweeds seedling and plastic rope

loans.name: Savali

texts.en:
Savali is a 47 year old mother with 3 children.  She runs a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Savali requested for a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags to assist her run the business. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2006. She will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Мужчину на фотографии зовут Алишер. Ему 35 лет. Он примерный семьянин и настоящий трудяга. Алишер муж и отец двоих детей. Алишер занимается изготовлением деревянных посуд. Деревянные посуды часть таджикского народа и он является одним из тех ремесленников, которые помогают сохранить древнюю культуру таджиков. Алишер принял данное ремесло от своего отца в наследство. Алишер решил увеличить производства товара и увеличить доход, чтобы покрыть растущие расходы семьи. Он собирается купить больше дерево. Для приобретения древесины он просит ему помочь. Поддержите Алишера - молодого ремесленника таджикского народа.
texts.en: The man in the photograph is called Alisher. He is 35 years old. He is an exemplary family man and genuine hard worker. Alisher is a husband and father of two children. Alisher manufacturers wooden dishes. Wooden dishes are a part of the Tajik people and he is one of those artisans who are helping to preserve the ancient Tajik culture. Alisher has taken up the craft from his father as an inheritance. Alisher has decided to increase his production of goods and to increase his income in order to cover his family's growing expenses. He is going to buy more wood. He is asking for help in buying the wood. Please support Alisher - a young craftsman of the Tajik nation.

loans.use: to buy wood to craft traditional dishes.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen, 31, is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. For the past six years she has operated a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.

Karen has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. She is working with the intention of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita is 48 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Jelita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Jelita has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jelita would like to save money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her pig fattening.

Emely dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Novelita

texts.en:
Novelita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, shampoo, coffee, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like tailoring.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Novelita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, shampoo, coffee, etc

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Flor is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Flor has a buy and sell livestock business in the Philippines. Flor requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more livestock and sell.

Flor has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Flor would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Vivian has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Vivian has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cesarlyn

texts.en:
Cesarlyn is married with four children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.   

Cesarlyn support the family through her fishing business in the Philippines.

She took an Educational loan for her daughter Sarah Lyn, 21 years old and is 3rd of 4 children in the family, who is studying Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering and is currently in the 4th of this 5 year course.

Cesarlyn is borrowing 16,500 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter Sarah Lyn for the First Semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Sarah Lyn plans when she graduates to help her parents to earn income.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees for a B.Sc.in Computer Engineering

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is 40 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 4 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past 14 years.  Naila's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints, her husband is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purpose. 

Therefore Naila has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business.
 
Naila is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business

loans.name: Teofista

texts.en: Teofista is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. She hopes to live comfortably with a renovated house supported by her loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Matter that Teofista has given a priority as a Microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she was thankful for when all the financing needs of her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house

loans.name: Jose Jr.

texts.en: Jose is 70 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with three children who are now grown adults. Jose has earned his living from agri-business activity, particularly in rice production, for 20 years already. He earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month from doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used to purchase construction materials for house repair and renovation. Jose has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, he hopes to expand his rice production activity by acquiring more parcels of rice land.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Gadoali

texts.ru:
Гадоали веселый и приветливый мужчина из городка Вахдат. Ему 48 лет. Он отец четверых детей. 
   Гадоали водитель маршрутки. Его работа начитается с раннего утра и до самого вечера. Он работает не покладая рук. Гадоали кормилец семьи и ему нужно больше работать, чтобы его дети и жена не нуждались. Сейчас машина Гадоали сломалась и он не может продолжить работу. Гадоали не может позволить себе не работать и просит помочь ему. Он на заемные деньги собирается купить автозапчасти и отремонтировать машину. Поддержите Гадоали.
texts.en:
Gadoali is a cheerful and friendly man from the town of Vahdat. He is 48 years old. He is the father of four children.

Gadoali is the driver of a fixed-route taxi van. His works begins early in the morning and continues until the very evening. He works without stopping. Gadoali is his family's breadwinner and he needs to work more so that his children and wife do not want for anything. Now Gadoali's van has broken and he cannot keep working. Gadoali cannot afford not to work, and he is asking for help. He will buy spare parts and repair his van with the borrowed money. Please support Gadoali.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his taxi van.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as creative. She operates a retail business where she sells textiles. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy gutters to enable her to harvest rain water for domestic use. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy gutters to enable her to harvest rain water

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Minda has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from food vending and buying and selling vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Minda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ernita

texts.en:
Ernita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her fishing. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ernita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a responsible mother of 5 children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 10 years. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance of his taxi because its current condition is not good and  it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Naseem has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Naseem's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Naseem  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Naseem is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: 's husband to repair his taxi

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is 30 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two school age children. Merlyn has been engaged in the cosmetics dealing business for one year already. The couple also earns a living from a motorcycle for hire and rice production and earns approximately PHP 8,500 each month doing these types of business activity. She has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for house repair. Merlyn has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to expand her cosmetics dealing business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is 32 years old woman, and mother of 1 child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller by profession, selling apples, bananas, grapes etc.

Saira's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose so that her husband can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position her husband is not in condition to purchase fruits for his business purposes.

Therefore Saira has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 59 years old, married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Lilia has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Isacar

texts.es:
ISACAR TIENE 27 AÑOS , CONVIVIENTE, SIN CARGA FAMILIAR, CONOCIDO EN EL MEDIO POR SU LABOR DE MAESTRO DE OBRA. VIVE EN CASA FAMILIAR, EN UNA COMUNIDAD UBICADA A 42 KMS DE LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERÚ. SALIDA DE MOCUPE, HABITADA POR GENTE RESPETUOSA DEDICADA AL COMERCIO Y GANADERIA.

ISACAR SE DEDICA A PRESTAR SU SERVICIO DE MAESTRO DE OBRAS EN EL DISTRITO DE MOCUPE, DESDE HACE 12 AÑOS APROXIMADAMENTE, CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS LABORALES Y PERSONALES, NECESITA PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MAS MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO TABLAS, ANDAMIOS, PALETAS, CARRETILLAR, ENTRE OTROS, PARA CUBRIR DE MEJOR MANERA LOS CONTRATOS QUE SE LE PRESENTAN, DE ESTA MANERA GENERAR MAYORES INGRESOS Y MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Isacar is 27 years old with a partner without family commitment. He is known for his handyman work.

He lives in a family home in a community located 42 km from Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. At the edge of Mocupe is where people earn their living through commerce and livestock.

Isacar has been making his living with his handyman services in the district of Mocupe for the last 12 years or so. With good professional and personal references, he requests a loan to invest in buying more construction materials such as tables, scaffolding, pallets, wheelbarrow etc. This will provide better presentation of the contracts thereby generating higher incomes and improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buying more construction materials such as tables, scaffolding, pallets, wheelbarrow etc.

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias is 58 years old and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He and his wife, Miriam, who is a midwife, are blessed with two children who are already in college. The majority of Filipinos struggle to make ends meet, but they do their best to provide for their children to give them a better future. 

For the past five years, Jeremias has operated a “videoke” rental business. No matter how hard life is in the Philippines, Filipinos are basically cheerful and happy people. During weekends, and on special occasions like birthdays, anniversaries, or even just an ordinary get-together, they gather at a friend's house to sing their favorite songs till the wee hours of the night. They often use a rented videoke, a music entertainment system in which a device plays the music of popular songs and people sing the words to songs they choose. Others go to a videoke bar to unwind after a week's hard work.

Jeremias is humbly requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to buy a videoke machine, microphones, and cable wires. He has already quite a number of clients in his community who rent his videoke machine almost every weekend. The only difficulty he encounters is there are times his videoke unit is returned damaged, but Jeremias hopes that his business will prosper as he adds new units to better serve his clients. He values his business as it helps augment his family’s income to send his two children to college. Jeremias is thanking God and you in advance for your financial help. 

Jeremias’s simple dream is to grow his entertainment business. He prays that God will bless him in all areas of his life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draws strength and inspiration from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase a videoke machine, microphones, and cable wires

loans.name: Kunja Bihari Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Nirupama is 37 years old and is the featured borrower of Kunja Bihari SHG-C from Koraput district. 

The lady standing to the right-hand side is Nirupama. She is happy tending her little store. She is married with three kids, and her husband is a driver. The store is her means of earning a living in support of her family. 

Unfortunately, she lacks proper sanitation facilities and has undergone treatment various times due to her illness that is caused due to open defecation and urination. However, she is asking for a loan in order to install sanitary facilities in her house, and in this way gradually improve the basic commodities of her home.

Nirupama, along with her fellow group member, Brundas, has applied for a loan of 36,000 INR. Nirupama will use her portion of the loan amount to buy water pipes, taps, a water tank and install a commode in order to improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy water pipes, taps, a water tank and install a commode

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marianita is 49 years old now.

Marianita has a food production/vending business in the Philippines. Marianita requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marianita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Marianita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 28 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in Tsalenjikha district. Merab owns 0.5 hectare land, where he grows nut trees. He sells the harvest locally. Merab decided to start additional business and requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan to start trading business. He will purchase a stock of clothes and will resell at higher price to get stable income and improve the living conditions for his family. Merab hopes that the business will be profitable and he awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade clothes

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 30 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as charcoal, home care products, and other groceries.

Mary Ann has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as charcoal, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Maria Filonela

texts.en:
As a woman, Maria Filonela works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Maria Filonela  is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maria Filonela  has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mohtoboi

texts.en:
Mohtoboi is a cheerful girl. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1995. She is single and lives with parents. She has thirst for mathematics  from her childhood, so at school she was different from her peers in math inclination.  After excellence graduation from secondary school she entered the university. She gets good and excellent marks and wants to be a professional in Informatics. 

She appealed to IMON asking financial support to pay her tuition fee of studies. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for a B.Sc. in Mathematics

loans.name: Ernelia

texts.en: Ernelia is 55 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has four children. Ernelia owns a general store that sells dry goods and other assorted groceries. She's been in this  business for 13 years already and earns approximately Php4,500.00 a month from this business. She is also earning support from her son's and daughter. She requested a loan to be used in  purchasing additional stocks of assorted groceries and dry goods for her general store. Ernelia has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Ernelia hopes to expand her general store business.

loans.use: To be used in  purchasing additional stocks of assorted groceries and dry goods

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is 39 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Leonida is separated and has three school age children. Leonida is a copra trader for almost 13 years already in their barangay. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this business activity. She is requesting a loan amount of PHP 14,900 to be used in purchasing additional coconuts for copra processing and re-trading. Leonida has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Leonida hopes to expand her coconut and copra trading business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional coconuts for her copra business

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 75 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 adult children. 
Conchita earns a living from her pension and from the support of her children. She is receiving monthly pension and support of not less than Php4,500 per month. This amount is so helpful in meeting her needs. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing an additional lot beside their residence.
Conchita has been a member of PMPC for 13 years and presently enjoying the benefits as a coop member.  Conchita hopes to save more in the coop for future use.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing an additional lot beside their residence

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marivic is 44 years old and has four children who are in school.

Marivic has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for five years. In the future, Marivic would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Llanie

texts.en:
Llanie is 30 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Llanie is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

Llanie has been farming rice  for 3 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to a machine to repair motorcycles and parts to repair bicycles

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 38 años de edad, ella vive junto a su hermosa familia en una comunidad de Nahualá.
Julia es una madre que trabaja duro para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos económicos, ella lo hace con el propósito de que sus hijos vivan mejor, Julia es una mujer que aprovecha su tiempo ella se levanta muy temprano para realizar sus oficios domésticos y en el trascurso del día se dedica a la elaboración de deliciosos panes, pues ella con el primer préstamo que tuvo en ADICLA logro comprar su terreno, y para poder efectuar sus pagos mensuales se propuso ser más creativa con su negocio de pan para mejorar sus ingresos, pero la vida nuevamente le presenta la oportunidad de poder  comprar otro terreno, ella con el afán de aprovechar esta oportunidad solicita un nuevo crédito para adquirir este terreno. Julia guarda las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito y también sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Julia is 38 years old and lives with her family in a beautiful community of Nahualá.

Julia is a mother who works hard to support her husband with the household income. She does it so that their children have a better life. Julia uses her time efficiently. She gets up very early to do the housework and, during the course of the day, she makes delicious breads. From her first loan through ADICLA, she was able to buy a land. In order to make the monthly payments, she is set out to be more creative with her bread business to improve her income. 

Life again presents the opportunity to buy more land. Julia requests a new loan to acquire this land. Julia hopes to obtain the loan and dreams of seeing her children turned into professionals.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Lek

texts.en:
Lek is a 61-year-old villager and a married father of two in their 20s from the northern part of the country. He wants to buy two dairy cows. For the past ten years, he's been doing agriculture/livestock work with the clientele of his products (300 eggs a month,6 liters a month and a calf a year) in a neighboring small city. He's got in his possession about 5 dynym of agricultural land where he plants mainly fodder for the animals so that he doesn't have to buy it. 
Lek also has one dairy cow, three pigs and 40 chickens. From the orchards they have, they don't sell fruit. To earn extra income Lek works in a nearby gas station for $118/month in addition to his retirement pension of $250/month.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud is a 40-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the Refugee Camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.
So, Mahmud took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Mahmud will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Neal’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Mahmud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 54 years old and single with two children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like accessories, personal care products, and other groceries.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marilyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like accessories, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Romalyn

texts.en:
Romalyn is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and is 25 years old.

Romalyn has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. Romalyn requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like lipstick, lotion, etc..

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Romalyn has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Romalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lipstick, lotion, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 42 years old and has five children. She is married, and four of her children are in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Teresita has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
Si José tuviese la oportunidad de cambiar algo en su vida, no cambiaría nada de lo que ha vivido, porque cada obstáculo y cada caída le han servido para fortalecer su espíritu y luchar por ser una mejor persona. Él a sus  22 años, está a un par de meses de recibir su título de licenciado en contabilidad pública, que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado, pues desde muy joven  tuvo que estudiar  y trabajar a la vez. 

Sin embargo, solicita un crédito para poder pagar los módulos de titulación y todos los trámites que le permitan graduarse lo más pronto posible. José es un joven soñador y perseverante, por ello planea especializarse en  finanzas y obtener su código como contador público autorizado.
texts.en:
If Jose had an opportunity to change something in his life, he would not change anything that he had experienced because every obstacle and every failure has served to strengthen his spirit and increase his drive to be a better person. At 22, he will be receiving his degree in public accounting. He has succeeded with hard work and sacrifice because, since he was young, he has had to work and study simultaneously. 

He is requesting a loan to pay for fees related to his degree and all the paperwork that will allow him to graduate as soon as possible. Jose is a young dreamer and very persistent so he plans to specialize in finance and get his title of certified public accountant.

loans.use: to pay for fees and paperwork to obtain his accounting degree

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is a 27 year-old, married man from Jbalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the Refugee Camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.
So, Waleed took a USD loan from FATEN, which will help enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Waleed Will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Neal’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Waleed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick floor and painting etc.

loans.name: Paterno

texts.en:
Paterno is 73 years old, married and from Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is in a buy-and-sell business of coconuts, which are sold as copra (dried coconut meat for cooking oil production). He has been doing this business for a long time. Through this business, he sent all his children to college. 

Paterno recalls that everything was made possible through the help of Paglaum MPC. Now, he seeks a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides for his cornfield.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides for his cornfield

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 50 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Teodora works very hard to provide for them.

Teodora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like candies, beverages, and other groceries.

Teodora has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like candies, beverages, and other groceries

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 54 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as biscuits, junk foods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Violeta has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, junk foods, candies, sugar, and other groceries.

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as biscuits, junk foods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Virginia is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell for her wine vending business.
