Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Clita

texts.en:
Clita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Clita is 59 years old now.

Clita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Clita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 43 years old and married with two children. With her two children in school, Eva works very hard to provide for them.

Eva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Eva has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Eva would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Dushigikire Group

texts.fr:
Clothilde   fait partie du groupe  Dushigikire  et  habite à  Gitega. Elle  a 34 ans et est marié à J. Claude, un commercant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 4  a 13 ans tous  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce des  bières  industrielles ( Amstel  et Primus )  et de la limonade  depuis 6 ans. 

Elle  est à son sixième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de caisses  de bière et de limonade    à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait acheter une parcelle  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Clothilde is part of the Dushigikire group and lives in Gitega. She is 34 years old and married to J. Claude, a trader. Together, they have four children, ages 4 to 13, all of whom attend school.

She has been selling industrial beer (Amstel and Primus) and lemon soda for 6 years. 

She is on her sixth loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan that she gets, she is going to augment her capital and buy several cases of beer and lemon soda to resell in order to earn more money.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land and send her children to school.

loans.use: to augment her capital and buy several cases of beer and lemon soda to resell and earn more money

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 43 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

For two years Liza has operated a general store in the Philippines selling a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, shampoo and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is a married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Victoria is 50 years old.

Ma. Victoria has a buy and sell assorted goods business in the Philippines. Ma. Victoria requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more assorted good to sell.

Ma. Victoria has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Ma. Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more assorted goods to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Susan works hard to support her family. She has a scrap business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs.  

Susan is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy more scrap to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more scrap to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to augment her capital to buy a large quantity of salt and several liters of palm oil to resell and earn more money

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es una joven de 24 años de edad, una campesina emprendedora, trabajadora que está dispuesta a sacar su familia adelante, para hacerlo quiere apoyarse del negocio que ha sido tradicional en su familia y el cual aprendió gracias a los conocimientos adquiridos de sus padres (cultivo y porcicultura).

Su afán de salir adelante tiene un motivo, su hijo, esa persona que alegra sus días y por el cual está dispuesta a dejar cada gota de sudor en el trabajo solo por generarle una excelente calidad de vida y un futuro prometedor.

Natalia desea solicitar un préstamo para cancelar la totalidad de un préstamo anterior y destinar una parte del capital en adecuación de cocheras y compra de crías de cerdos.
texts.en:
Natalia is a young 24-year-old. She is an enterprising and hardworking countrywoman. She is ready and willing to support her family. She wants to support her business that has been a tradition in her family, which is farming and raising pigs. She has learned this activity from her parents.

Her desire to succeed comes from her son. She is a happy person who is willing to work hard and sweat just to generate a better quality of life and a promising future for him.

Natalia wants to borrow to pay off an entire previous loan and use part of the capital to improve her pig pens and purchase piglets.

loans.use: pay off a previous loan, improve her pig pens, and purchase piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 55 years old. She is from the community of Moalboal in Cebu. She is married with a three-year-old dependent.

Virginia owns a shop in her place where she sells souvenir items like accessories, printed shirts, wallets and bags. The place where she lives, Moalboal, is full of tourists due to the beach and to diving spots in the nearby island. Virginia is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell like bangles, handicrafts, slippers and shirts. This is her way to increase her sales.

Virginia hopes to buy a new pump boat in the future.

loans.use: to buy bangles, handicrafts, slippers and shirts

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia, 50 years old, is a vendor (of fruits and vegetables) by trade. For five years now, her three children witnessed how she endured everything just to find a way to support Rodolfo (her husband) in generating enough income to provide for the family. 

Amelia didn't finish her studies. Though it was actually a disappointment, she never considers herself a mess. In contrast, she strives even more to prove that success is never far from reach to those who have the guts to take risks and courage to face life. 

She is very enthusiastic and positive in life. In fact, she is very hopeful today that you would allow her to borrow the amount she needed (PHP 10,000 in particular) to garner additional stock of fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall at the marketplace. Maybe this is also the reason why her colleagues enjoy her company. 

To mention, they regularly meet every week to encourage one another (simultaneously studying the word of God). She has this living hope. She believes that someday, through hard work, her inventory will grow and that her family conditions will stay safe, successful and sound.  

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to garner additional stock of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Fe is 45 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Fe has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Fe has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a meat vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell to her customers.

Rowena has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from direct selling Avon products and raising pigs.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell to her customers

loans.name: Tontinogo Group

texts.fr:
Alizatta est une femme marié de 42 ans. Elle 05 enfants. Elle faits le commerce de vente de jus il y a 17 ans. Son sucrés  dans l'activité est la saveur est la saveur et la qualité des ses jus. Elle très accueillante. Ses principaux clients sont les organisateurs de cérémonies ( baptême,mariage...) elle est très sollicité pendant les mariage aussi.
Elle est à son 3 crédit à ACFIME qu'elle payer correctement.
Elle veut le crédit pour acheter 03 sacs de poids de terre sucré, un congélateur.
texts.en: Alizatta is a married 42-year-old woman. She has five children. She has been selling juice for 17 years. Her sweet spot is the taste and quality of her juices. She is very welcoming. Her main customers are ceremony organizers (baptisms, weddings,…). She is very solicited during weddings as well. She is on her third loan at ACFIME, which she is repaying properly. She wants this loan to buy three sacks of sweet Bambara peas and a freezer.

loans.use: to buy 03 sacks of sweet Bambara peas and a freezer

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Luzminda works hard to support her family.

She has a food production/vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Luzminda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Luzminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Trinité

texts.fr: Trinité est une femme mariée âgée de 43 ans.  Habitant à Tokoin, Trinité est mère de deux enfants. Trinité est une revendeuse mobile d’ignames  qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Trinité désire ce prêt pour commander des ignames. Trinité souhaite réaliser une bonne marge de bénéfice sur son commerce et promouvoir ainsi l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Trinité is a 43-year-old married woman. Living in Tokoin, Trinité is a mother of two. Trinité is a door-to-door seller of yams who stocks up twice a month at the market. Trinité wants this loan to order some yams. Trinité wishes to earn a good profit on her business and thus to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy six yam gourds

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en:
Nelsa is 33 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Nelsa works very hard to provide for them.

Nelsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other items.

Nelsa has been in this business for 1 year now. 

In the future, Nelsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other items

loans.name: Maa Baman Dei Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Jasmin, a 29-year-old lady, is the featured borrower of Maa Baman Dei SHG-D from the village Kandulguda of Koraput district. Jasmin is the one standing to the right in the photo. She has two underage children who are in school. Her husband owns a betel shop near her house. Jasmin has been a poultry farmer for over seven years and spends her earnings on household expenses. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine. She, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet. She wants to prevent herself from unnecessary medical expenditures for the disease that will be caused by open defecation; that is why she took the concrete step to build a toilet.

She aspires to build a small and beautiful house where she can live happily with her family.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to pay laborers' salaries for farm preparation.

Lita supplements her rice farming income with earnings from raising pigs. She dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay laborers' salaries for farm preparation.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosa requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for twenty years now.

Rosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sombrero De Sao Group

texts.es:
Silvia continúa con su negocio de tejido de sombreros de Sao. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de hojas de Sao, tela, pegamento y otros. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. Su siguiente meta es abrir un puesto de venta en el mercado. Debido a la buena ayuda recibida anteriormente, ella formó de nuevo la banca de personas para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su principal necesidad es la hoja de la palmera de Saó, esta se corta de la parte superior de la palmera, a una altura de 20 metros, los ‘palmeros’ trepan hasta lo más alto, armados de un  machete y sin ninguna medida de seguridad, “La mayoría del pueblo y de comunidades aledañas vivimos de la palmera de saó, es nuestra principal necesidad…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son por mayor, la desventaja es la falta capital para la compra de materiales de trabajo. Su sueño es cubrir los gastos de su familia, ella desea realizar la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sombreros de sao. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de manera continua.
Es por esos motivos que Silvia solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la confección de sombreros de Sao y con los beneficios alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia is continuing with her business of sewing hats of Sao palm. Her previous loan was invested in purchasing Sao leaves, cloth, glue, and other necessary items. Her scheduled payments were punctually made with no problems. And her new goal is to open a sales stall in the local market.

Due to the good support she has received, Silvia has organized, once again, this bank of persons to solicit a loan and improve their activities. Her principal need is Sao palm leaves. They is cut from the upper part of the palm tree at the height of 20 meters. The palm leaf harvestors climb to the highest point with their machete and without any means of security. “The majority of the village and the surrounding communities live from the Sao palm; it is out principal necessity,” she comments. The advantage of the business is that sales are at wholesale. The disadvantage is the lack of capital for purchasing work materials.

Silvia's dream is to cover the family's expenses. She wants to buy primary materials for making her Sao palm hats. This is her second in a series of loans with our institution during the seven consecutive years she has been involved in this activity.

That is why Silvia is requesting a loan – to purchase primary materials so that she can continue making Sao palm hats and with the earnings, feed her family.

loans.use: to buy primary materials for making  hats from Sao, in order to support  the family.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 63 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from food vending.

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and personal care products.

Milagros has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and personal care products

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 61 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lorna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorna has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is 56 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rogelia has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

Rogelia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock like candies, biscuits, noodles, soft drinks, cooking oil, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Rogelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like candies, biscuits, noodles, soft drinks, cooking oil, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Maria is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items like cereals, coffee, noodles, sanitary pads, soft drinks, etc. to sell for her general store business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like cereals, coffee, noodles, sanitary pads, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Landilina

texts.en:
Landilina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Landilina has been in this business for 2 years. Landilina earns additional income from food vending.

Landilina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Melita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Melita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more dry goods to sell from her stall for her business.

Melita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell from her stall

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store, like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, etc.

Myrna has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nerissa works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell at the market via her fish vending business.

Nerissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at the market

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 57 years old and married with four children, one of whom is presently in school. Nimfa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and personal care products.

Nimfa has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and personal care products

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
Rosa, de 25 años de edad, está estudiando bachillerato a distancia, está acompañada, su pareja administra un comedor y por el momento no tienen hijos y viven en casa familiar.

Rosa, se dedica a vender en un comedor que tienen junto a su pareja, el negocio lo tienen desde hace varios años, está ubicado en casa de su suegra y el horario de atención es de 6:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos para elaborar los alimentos como pollo, carne, arroz y otros para elaborar almuerzos y cenas, de esa manera lograra mejorar su comedor y tendrá más cliente.

El sueño de Rosa, es seguir trabajando junto a su pareja y con el tiempo tener más clientela para seguir obteniendo mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 25 years old and is studying through distant learning. She is married and her husband manages a diner. At the moment, they do not have children and they live in a family home. Rosa makes a living selling food in the diner with her husband. They have had the business for several years. It is located in the home of her mother-in-law and business hours are from 6:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M.
She needs the loan to buy supplies to make food such as chicken, meat, rice and others for making lunches and dinners. This way, she can manage to improve her dining area and have more customers. Rosa's dream is to keep working with her husband and over time to have more customers to keep getting a better income.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food such as chicken, meat, rice and others for making lunches and dinners.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy home products to resell using a stall

loans.name: Macrena

texts.en:
Macrena works hard to support her family. Macrena is married and she has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Macrena requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Macrena has been in this business for 30 years now.

Macrena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is a 43-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Venancia has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

Venancia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Venancia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 62 years old and married with five children. Crispina works very hard to provide for them.

Crispina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Crispina has been in this business for 7 years. 

In the future, Crispina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Polly

texts.en:
Polly is a 45-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a weaving business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her business.

Polly has been in this business for 18 years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. Lorna is married and has a fishing vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Lorna  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 42 years old and married with five children.  With all children in school, Lanie works very hard to provide for them.

Lanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Lanie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food and other groceries. 

In the future Lanie would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Jose desde hace 25 años se dedica a la producción agrícola y diariamente se levanta para trabajar y atender sus tierras en las cuales tiene cultivos principalmente de plátano.
Es una actividad aprendida de manera empírica y poco a poco ha ido perfeccionando sus técnicas y habilidades en este campo.
Adicionalmente genera ingresos alternos gracias a su trabajo como jornalero.
Hoy en día se siente orgulloso de lo que ha podido construir con su esfuerzo y se siente muy agradecido con la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva por las oportunidades que le brindan de progresar.
El pide un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abonos, riegos y pesticidas, de este modo mantener sus tierras en optimas condiciones para los cultivos.
Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y allí poder disfrutar de su vejez al lado de su esposa.
texts.en:
For 25 years, Jose has made a living in agricultural production. Every day he gets up to work and tend to his land which mainly has banana crops. He learned this work from experience and little by little he has perfected his techniques and abilities in this field. Additionally, he gets alternative income thanks to his job as a day laborer. 

He feels very proud of what he has been able to construct with his efforts and he feels very thankful to the Corporación Interactuar and the Kiva loaners for the opportunities that they give him to progress. 

He is asking for a loan to invest into buying fertilizers, irrigation and pesticides to be able to keep his land in optimal conditions for his crops. His biggest dream is to have his own home and be able to enjoy his old age with his wife at his side.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, irrigation and pesticides to be able to keep his land in optimal conditions for his crops.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Theresa is 49 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Ma. Theresa requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Ma. Theresa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Cerina

texts.en:
Cerina is married with four children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.   

Cerina support the family through her buy and sell recycled materials business in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her son Cyril, 18 years old and who is 4th of four children in the family, who is studying Bachelor of Science in Marine Transportation and is currently in the 2nd of this 4 year course.

Cerina is borrowing 14,000 to pay for tuition fees of her son Cyril for the First Semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Cyril, plans when he graduates to help her parents earn an income.

loans.use: to pay 2nd year tuition fees for her son's B.Sc in Marine Transportation

loans.name: Nancy Goya

texts.es:
La socia Nancy pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Nancy es docente de profesión, a la  vez la socia continua realizando su negocio de tejidos hechos a mano, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de lanas de colores.
texts.en:
Nancy belongs to the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in the city of Cusco.

Nancy is a teacher by profession and also continuing her hand-knitting business. She is having a good time with her business. It is doing well due to the effort she puts in every day. She wants to continue working in this way so that she can continue to support her family.

Nancy requests a loan to buy colored wool.

loans.use: to buy colored wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer,

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Marieta has been in this business for 7 years. Marieta earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Lorlyn

texts.en:
Lorlyn is 56 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Lorlyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lorlyn requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

She has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Lorlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 38 years old and married with one child.

Angeles works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like vinegar, coffee, candies, biscuits, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Angeles has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Angeles aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like vinegar, coffee, candies, biscuits, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Dyna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Dyna works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Dyna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Dyna has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman with two children in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosita is 43 years old.

Rosita has a buy and sell eggs business in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more trays of eggs to sell to her customers.

Rosita has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more trays of eggs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer 2 Group

texts.es:
Don Natividad tiene 60 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos en el municipio de Intibucá. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura y tiene más de 31 años de tener sus propios cultivos. Siempre ha cosechado maíz, frijoles, papas y tomate. Actualmente su mayor producción y venta es la papa la que vende en el mercado local. Solicita otro préstamo en forma grupal para comprar insecticidas, abonos, gallinaza, y semilla de papas para su cultivo y darle buena asistencia. Su idea es aumentar el área de producción para incrementar ingresos familiares.
Don natividad pertenece al grupo llamado Nuevo Renacer 2, que está formado por 6 miembros, todos viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican al cultivo de papa y granos básicos. El préstamo grupal es por 64,000 Lempiras que los invertirán en la compra de abonos, semillas e insecticidas para el cultivo de papas. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda sentados esta Natividad, Maria y Eugenio a la derecha y de pie esta Celso, Angel y Eusebio a la derecha.
texts.en:
Don Natividad is 60 years old, and lives with his wife and four children in the municipality of Intibucá. He has always worked in agriculture, and he has had his own crops for more than 30 years. He has always harvested corn, beans, potatoes, and tomatoes. Currently, his biggest production is potatoes, which he sells in the local market. 

He is requesting another group loan in order to purchase insecticide, compost, hen droppings, and potato seed for growing and caring well for his crop. His idea is to expand the production area in order to increase his family’s income.

Don Natividad belongs to the group called Nuevo Renacer 2, which is composed of 6 members, all of whom live in the same community and work growing potatoes and basic grains. The group loan is for 64,000 Lempiras [$2,950] that they will invest in the purchase of compost, seed, and insecticide for growing potatoes. 

In the photo, they are identified from left to right in this way: Natividad, María, and Eugenio are seated, and Celso, Angel, and Eusebio are standing.

loans.use: to purchase insecticide, compost, and hen droppings to care for his potato crop, and potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina es una mujer trabajadora de 38 años de edad, vive junto a sus 4 hijos y su pareja en la localidad rural de Pampamarca, que esta ubicado en Arequipa. Ella se dedica a la agricultura y actualmente gusta de sembrar quinua en su terreno agrícola, el cual ya lo ha venido preparando con abono orgánico, solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar semilla orgánica mejorada de quinua y para pagar a las personas que le ayudaran con la siembra de su cultivo. Marcelina espera en un futuro no muy lejano poder mejorar su casa para que sus hijos puedan vivir cómodamente, ademas se esforzara mucho para que sus hijos reciban una buena educación y sean personas de muchos valores.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a 38 year old hard working woman. She lives with her four children and her partner in the rural town of Pampamarca, Arequipa. She earns living in agriculture and wants to plant quinoa. The land has already been prepared with organic fertilizer. 

Marcelina requests a loan to buy improved organic quinoa seed and to pay people to help her with planting. 

Marcelina hopes to improve her home in the near future so that her children can live comfortably. She also will try hard to have her children receive good education and be valuable.

loans.use: to plant organic quinoa.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 48 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Luzminda works very hard to provide for them.

Luzminda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy beverages, canned goods, personal care products and other groceries. She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Luzminda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La socia María Esther pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia María Esther, la socia sigue con su carrera de guía de turismo, la socia lleva bue tiempo dedicándose  atrabajar el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para pagar gastos de educación.
texts.en:
María Esther is a member of the communal bank, “Patrón de San Sebastián” in the city of Cusco. 

María Esther continues studying to be a tourist guide. She has been working a long time, and her business is going well for her because of the effort that she puts into it every day. She wants to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan to pay education expenses.

loans.use: to pay education costs.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Lyida works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lyida is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lyida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Erika Samantha

texts.es: Erika tiene 39 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo pequeño con capacidades diferente y vive en la ciudad de México. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que se siente orgullosa de que sus padres la educaron para ser independiente, responsable y superarse por sí sola, se siente feliz por ser un ejemplo para su hijo. Desde hace 10 años cuando su hijo nació, ella se vio en la necesidad de encontrar una fuente de ingresos extra, por esa razón ella puso una pequeña tienda de dulces fuera de su casa, el negocio le ha resultado muy fructífero y piensa en un futuro poder poner una bodega de dulces. Con un préstamo de MXN 10,000 Erika podrá surtir completamente su tienda y poder comprar mesas para ofrecer más variedad de dulces. Su mayor motivación es su hijo y su mayor sueño en la vida es ver a su hijo independiente y con una carrera universitaria. Ella agradece mucho a todas las personas que la ayudarán a cumplir sus sueños y a ofrecerle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
Erika is a 39 year old single mother of a small child. She has different skills and lives in Mexico City. She is hard working and is proud that her parents brought her up to be independent, responsible and self-sufficient. She is happy to be an example for her child. 

10 years ago when her son was born, she saw the need to find a source of extra income. This is why she put a small candy store out of her home. Her business has been very successful and she is thinking about a candy store for the future. 

With a loan of MXN 10,000 Erika will be able to fully stock her store and to buy tables to provide more variety of sweets. Her biggest motivation is her son. Her greatest dream in life is to see her son become independent with a university degree. She is grateful to everyone who helps her fulfill the dreams and offers the best to her child.

loans.use: to fully stock her store and to buy tables.

loans.name: Graciela Alicia

texts.es: Graciela tiene 52 años, es soltera y vive en la Ciudad de México. Ella estudio sociología, es una mujer que valora mucho la paz mental y el equilibrio interior. Desde hace 3 años ella inició un negocio de venta de zapatos por catálogo, ella empezó este negocio para obtener un ingreso extra sin embargo ahora es su principal fuente de ingresos. Ella quiere lograr que todos sus clientes queden satisfechos con los zapatos que les ofrece, su principal dificultad son las personas morosas que no pagan a tiempo los productos que han comprado. Ella solicita un préstamo de  MXN 5,000 para poder invertir en volumen mayor de zapatos. Graciela en su tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música y leer, por cierto su mayor sueño en la vida sería escribir un libro de superación personal para poder ayudar a muchas personas. Ella se considera emprendedora porque es constante y motiva a la gente, agradece a todos los prestamistas que confían en ella y la podrán ayudar a hacer un cambio en su entorno.
texts.en: Graciela, 52, is unmarried and lives in Mexico City.  She studied sociology, and she is a woman who greatly values peace of mind and inner balance.  Three years ago, she started a business selling shoes by catalog.  She began this business to earn extra income, but now it is her main source of income.  She wants all of her customers to be satisfied with the shoes that she sells.  Her main difficulty is the slow payers that don’t pay on time for the products they have purchased. She is requesting a loan of 5, 000 MXN to invest in a greater volume of shoes.  In her free time, Graciela enjoys listening to music and reading.  Indeed, her greatest dream in life would be to write a book about her personal success, which would help many people. She considers herself enterprising because she is persevering and motivates people.  She is grateful to all the lenders who trust in her as they will enable her to help make a change in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a greater volume of shoes.

loans.name: Abdel Razeq

texts.en:
Abdel Razeq is a 35-years-old married man from Gaza. He is a father for one son and one daughter. Eight years ago, Abdel opened a sewing workshop. he takes orders from the local traders. Abdel now has a very good experience.

Abdel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy textile and yarns for his sewing workshop. this will enable him to increase his productivity and also his income. 
Abdel appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy textile and yarns for his sewing workshop.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is aged 47 years, married to Mary and he supports 4 children. 

He has been selling animal feeds to clients for the last 25 years and the business earns him KES 15,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase poultry and animal feeds for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs. 

He plans to gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sell to clients and educate his children. 

His hope is to expand his business sector, improve sanitation and eradicate poverty in his family.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and animal feeds for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is aged 55 years, married to Jane and he supports 4 children. 

He has been a farmer to clients for the last 10 years and the business earns him KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase, fertilizers, poultry and animal feeds so as to boost his agricultural produce for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs. 

He plans to gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sell to clients and educate his children. 

His hope is to expand his business sector, improve sanitation and eradicate poverty in his family.

loans.use: to purchase, fertilizers, poultry and animal feeds so as to boost his agricultural produce for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a cultured seaweed business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional seaweed seedlings and other materials for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional seaweeds seedlings and other materials for her business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married with four children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. 
  
Lucia support the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

She took an Educational loan for her daughter Aimee, 16 years old and is 4th of four children in the family, who is studying Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and is currently in the 1st of this 4 year course.

Lucia is borrowing 9,000 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter Aimee for the First Semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Aimee plans when she graduates to help her parents earn an income.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees for her B.Sc.in Computer Science

loans.name: Jordania Vanessa

texts.es:
Jordania nació en una familia que por tradición se dedica a los negocios, prácticamente ha vivido toda su vida de esto; por ello, no fue nada extraño cuando decidió iniciar un negocio propio para hacerse independiente. Ella se siente agradecida porque ha tenido el apoyo de su esposo en los momentos más prósperos y  más difíciles, pues no siempre se va bien en las ventas pero con el apoyo de su familia ha podido salir adelante. Incluso, hoy posee una de las ventas de ropa y chinelas más surtidas de su zona de comercio.  

Por ello, solicita un crédito para comprar, camisas, shorts, camisolines, pantalones, faldas y chinelas. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá ofrecer variedad de productos y le será más fácil vender sus prendas. En consiguiente, aumentará sus ingresos y podrá ahorrar para comprar un local mejor ubicado.
texts.en:
Jordania was born into a family which has traditionally engaged in business. She has lived almost her entire life in business. It was not surprising when she decided to start her own business to become independent. She is grateful because she had the support of her husband in the most prosperous and difficult times. It hasn’t gone well all the time but with the support of her family, she has been able to succeed. Today, she has a clothes and slippers store that is one of the more well stocked in the area.

Jordania requests a loan to buy shirts, shorts, gowns, pants, skirts and slippers. This will help her offer variety of products and make it easier to sell items. Consequently, it will increase her income and she will be able to save to buy better location.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shorts, gowns, pants, skirts and slippers.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married and she has 3 children. She has been involving in business activities since 2013, when she started with her own working capital of $ 400.00.  She has a kiosk in front of her house and now she is requesting a loan of $ 1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improving her business. 

She istaking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin, which she will use to buy additional supplies including tea, sardines, cooking oils, cigarettes, noodles, sweets, Including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.use: To buy tea, sardines, cooking oils, cigarettes, noodles, sweets, Including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
Lupe is 40 years old with 1 child. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. 

Lupe requested for a loan to buy wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2012, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling),

loans.name: Lilo

texts.en:
Lilo is 42 years old with three children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Lilo requested a loan to buy banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2012 and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a young man how has a barber shop which has been opened for the past one year. Mahmoud has now a good experience and he is well known in his city, Khan Younis. He loves his job and always thinks how to improve it.

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new chair and tools for his barber shop. This will improve his business and make his barber shop more attractive.
Mahmoud appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new chair and tools for his barber shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, sorghum, cooking oil, sweets, eggs, soft drinks, and many other products for her store.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a retired government employee who also had a passion in farming. He has been into rice production for 30 years to date. He lives in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte, married, with no children. His farming activities enable him to support the schooling of his nieces & nephews, as he doesn't have children of his own.  
He is thankful to the cooperative because he can always turn to it for his financial needs. Recently, he avails a loan to pay for labor cost in land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling & sowing. 

Jose is looking forward for good harvest this season so that he can help his extended family.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost in land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling & sowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain

loans.name: Jerresa

texts.en:
Buy-and-sell business succeeds if the entrepreneur knows how to gauge the current needs of the customers. Jerresa, 53, from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo wants to take advantage of the rainy season, hence she choose to sell umbrellas, rain coats, rain shoes and sandals made from plastic and rubber, and canvas covers. She has a place inside her house where customers are invited to select their desired products. She’s pretty sure that customers won’t leave without buying at least one item because her products are really essential during this season of rain. The demand will surely rise in the next four to five months, and Jerresa is planning to purchase more of these products. She needs additional capital of PhP 40,000 for this purpose. Your generosity will be a great blessing to her and her family.

She is married to Joel, a farmer. They are still supporting the college education of their youngest child. She dreams of a happy and successful life together with her whole family. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more umbrellas, rain coats, rain shoes and sandals, and canvas covers

loans.name: Glacelyn

texts.en:
This is Glacelyn, 29, from the beautiful town of Polomolok, South Cotabato. She is married to Greggy, 29, and they have three young children. Glacelyn’s husband is not only her life partner but also her business buddy. Both of them strive hard to enhance their “sari-sari” or variety store business. Greggy also drives his tricycle for added income. 

They are a young couple who are still in their adjustment period but are geared towards one direction: to have a happy family living at their own house, with sufficient resources, a viable business, and successful careers for their children. Glacelyn wants to take another step towards this dream by availing herself of additional capital worth 60,000 PHP. She will buy more supplies for her variety store so as to meet the demands of customers who prefer a store with wide selections. She knows that she can earn higher income with an enhanced capital. Subsequently, she can set aside more savings while her children’s needs are not yet that costly.

She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her variety store

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion, 30 years old, is married and has three children. For the past 5 years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Salvacion also earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise the pigs. Salvacion works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise pigs

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy, 34 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. Daisy works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for eleven years and also earns an income from fattening pigs. Daisy has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. 

Daisy has previously borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Perlinda

texts.en:
Perlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell seaweed business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy seaweed seedlings and plastic rope for her buy and sell seaweed business.

Perlinda has been in this business for 7 years. Perlinda earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and plastic rope

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 52 years old and married.

Adelfa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Adelfa requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Adelfa has been raising pigs for twenty years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Adelfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net, gallon of gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and baking flour for making mandazi and chapati for sale to clients to meet both client and family needs

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra is married and she works hard to support her family. She has been running a fish vending business in the Philippines for 8 years. Alejandra has requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, Alejandra would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married with five children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.  
 
Joyce support the family through her fishing business in the Philippines.

She took an Educational loan for her son Cio Jade, 17 years old, single and is 4th of five children in the family, who is studying Bachelor of Science in Marine Transportation and is currently in the 1st of this 4 year course.

Joyce is borrowing 13,100 to pay for tuition fees of her son Cio Jade for the First Semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Cio Jade plans when he graduates to help her parents earn an income to send her brother and sister in college.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son's B.Sc. in Marine Transportation

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Alma Mie is 19 years old and is 1st of the two children in the family. Her mother Marivic a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Alma Mie is studying Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education and is currently in the 3rd of this 4-year course.

Marivic is borrowing PHP 15000 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter Alma Mie for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

Alma Mie plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's 3rd year tuition fees for a B.Sc in Secondary Education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle engine, chains, greasing oil and pistons for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle to offer better and faster transportation services to clients.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 25-year-old mother with four children. She runs a business of selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living.

Josephine requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and fry pan to assist her to run the business. She hopes to use her profits to build a small bakery store in the near future. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and fry pan.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle, 36 years old, is happily married to Jameson, her business partner, and blessed with children. They live on the beautiful island of Coron in Palawan. They may not have the luxuries enjoyed by families living in first world countries but, as with most Filipinos, Rochelle's family is happy and content with the simple life, having three meals a day and sending their children to school. 

Rochelle has a small general store, which is their source of income to meet the family's day-to-day needs and the children's schooling. Although her sales are low, at times, because of bad weather, Rochelle maintains her positive outlook and joyful spirit that she can get through with their lives.

To help sustain and expand her store operations, Rochelle is humbly asking your help for a PHP 40,000 loan to buy large quantities of grocery items, such as canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, beverages etc. She wants to make sure that her store can offer most of the essential food and household items. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. Rochelle's earnings will be a big help to cover the family's daily needs and the children's schooling.

Rochelle dreams of having a big grocery store someday. She aims to give her children a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. Rochelle faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 31 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

Priscilla has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 33 years old and has five children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jennifer has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Annalee

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Annalee works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from plastic-wares. Annalee is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional clothing to sell to customers.

Annalee has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 42 years old, married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. .

Mary Ann has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is age 38 years, married to Evans, and she supports five children. She has been operating in her beauty salon for the last 18 years and the business earns her KES 6,000 per month.

Joyce has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production, so as to sell milk to clients for more income gain.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to advance family projects. Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production, so as to sell milk to clients for more income gain.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, requiere de un nuevo financiamiento para comprar prendas de vestir, calzado así como también maíz, cal, gas propano y leña, fortalecerá su negocio y continuará elaborando la venta de tortillas, de esta manera cubrirá las necesidades de sus nuevos clientes.
Ella utilizo el crédito anterior para incrementar la mercadería que ofrece en su negocio, gracias a ello cuenta con más clientes, sus ingresos han mejorado y puede ofrecer a su familia un estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Maria requests a loan to buy clothing, footwear as well as corn, lime, propane and firewood. This will strengthen her business and continue to grow the tortillas sales and cover the needs of her new customers.

She used the previous loan to increase the merchandise offered in her business. Thanks to that, she has more customers and better income. She can offer her family more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear as well as corn, lime, propane and firewood, in order to strengthen her business and continue to grow the tortillas sales.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia es una mujer muy hábil para los negocios, ella ofreció inicialmente el servicio de pensión a universitarias y les elaboraba los almuerzos.  Cuando recibieron su grado profesional, la contrataron para que les hiciera los almuerzos a ellas y otras amigas que estaban necesitando de este servicio. Ana Cecilia reside en un barrio de la Ciudad de Cartagena y desde la comodidad de su hogar maneja su negocio de elaboración de desayunos y almuerzos, hoy en día cuenta con dos años de ofrecer diferentes platillos como sopas, carnes, arroces, ensaladas, jugos, empandas, huevos revueltos y demás platos típicos de la región.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en una estufa industrial, parrillas para asar y víveres.  Esta inversión permitirá responder a la creciente demanda que está presentando su negocio.  Su meta a largo plazo es incrementar la cantidad de clientes y  adecuar un restaurante en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia is a woman who is very adept at business. She initially offered housing to female university students and prepared their lunches. When they got their degrees, they hired her to make their lunches for them and for other friends who were in need of this service.

Ana Cecilia lives in a neighborhood of the city of Cartagena and from the comfort of her home, she manages her business of making breakfasts and lunches. For the last two years, she has been offering different dishes like soups, meats, rice dishes, salads, juices, "empanadas" [savory stuffed pastries], scrambled eggs, and other traditional regional fare. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to invest in an industrial stove, grill pans for roasting, and groceries.

Her long-term goal is to increase the quantity of customers and to set up a restaurant in her house.

loans.use: to invest in an industrial stove, grill pans for roasting, and groceries.

loans.name: Olga Esperanza

texts.es:
Olga, de 31 años de edad, está casada, tiene dos hijos y su esposo se dedica a la prestación de servicios de mecánica automotriz y sus hijos se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad. 

Olga, tiene 15 años de experiencia en venta de productos de primera necesidad, está actividad la aprendió de su madre, quien era una mujer muy emprendedora y fue quien le enseño a desempeñarse en este negocio; uno de sus hijos le ayuda por las tardes, porque en la mañana estudia.  

El dinero será utilizado para instalar un cafetín en el centro escolar de su comunidad, porque le han otorgado el permiso para que lo coloque, con este cafetín ella mejorar sus ingresos para su familia y cumplir con sus obligaciones crediticias.

Los sueños de Olga son, comprar un vehículo que le sirva para trasladar su mercadería de su casa hacía el cafetín y colocar un negocio de comida rápida, para que lo administren sus hijas.
texts.en:
Olga is 31 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband works providing automotive mechanic services and her children are in the community school. 

Olga has 15 years' experience selling staple products. She learned this activity from her mother, who was a very enterprising woman. She was the one who taught her to work in this business. One of her children helps her in the afternoon, because he goes to school in the morning.  

The money will be used to set up a snack shop in the school venter in her community. She has been given permission to put one there. With this snack shop, she will improve her income for her family and pay off some debts. 

Olga's dreams are to buy a vehicle she can use to transport her merchandise from her house to the snack shop, and to open a fast food business, so that her children can run it.

loans.use: to set up a snack shop in the school center in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more trees for cutting and making timber for sale to clients, and to meet both clients' and his family's needs.

loans.name: Bellentina

texts.en:
Bellentina is 31 years old with four children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. Bellentina requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro root (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, and backpack sprayer to assist her to run the business.

She joined SPBD in 2013, and hopes to use her profits to expand her business and provide for family daily needs.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, and backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is age 50 years, married to David, and she supports four children. She has been a farmer for the last 25 years and the business earns her KES 6,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing her crops, so as to get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market.

She plans to purchase a dairy cow for milk production, so as to sell milk to clients and expand her agricultural projects. Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing her crops, so as to get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market.

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Ma. Corazon is 56 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ma. Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Ma. Corazon has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in wholesale corn, in this way saving on her purchase and improve her profit.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Her family lives at Solana. She is engaged in food vending to gain income. She hopes to acquire more profits.

That is why she is now asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy flour, cooking oil, eggs and hotdogs to cook and sell. She hopes to continue selling delicious foods and friendly services as well.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, eggs and hotdogs to sell.

loans.name: Zulema Lisseth

texts.es:
Zulema, ha utilizado los créditos para mantenerse vendiendo pan dulce y generar los recursos económicos que tanto necesita para subsistir con su familia, comenta que actualmente ya realizo el cambio de  techo en su vivienda y que no ha tenido dificultades en su negocio.
Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar pan dulce que luego sale a revender, tendrá capital para abastecer su negocio cada vez que sea necesario y mantener satisfechos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zulema has used the loans to continue selling pastries and to generate the economic resources that she so much needs to survive along with her family. She comments that now she has replaced the roof of her house and that she has not had any difficulties in her business.

She is applying for a new loan in order to buy pastries that she will then go out to sell. She will have capital to stock her business each time that it is necessary and to keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy pastries that she will later go out to sell; she will have capital to stock her business each time that it is necessary and to keep her customers satisfied.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 62 years old and married with nine children. Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Editha has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Perlee

texts.en:
Perlee is 35 years old and has two children. Perlee is married and has two children who are in school.

Perlee is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Perlee requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Perlee has been raising livestock for 9 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Perlee would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Epefania is 60 years old and has one child in school.

Epefania has a food vending business in the Philippines. Epefania requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Epefania has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Epefania would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 52 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Erma works very hard to provide for them.

Erma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Erma has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Erma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estelita is 49 years old and has one child in school.

Estelita has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Estelita requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fruits to sell.

Estelita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Estelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Mardessa

texts.en:
Mardessa is 22 years old with one child in school. Mardessa works very hard to provide for them.

Mardessa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, beverages, home care products and other groceries. Mardessa has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Mardessa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Consolita

texts.en:
Consolita is 66 years old and is married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Consolita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 29,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, groceries, etc. 

Consolita has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mary Bethany

texts.en:
Mary Bethany is 35 years old and is married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Bethany has a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more inventory of groceries to resell.

Mary Bethany has been in this business for 7 years, and she sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Mary Bethany would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of groceries to resell.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta works hard to support her family. Marietta is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.

She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Marietta has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Marietta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
