Maria is a 37 year old mother with 3 children, she runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. 

Maria requested for a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags, to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags,

loans.name: David Alexander

texts.es: David tiene 25 años de edad y vive junto a su familia conformada por sus padres y su compañera de vida de una edad de 21 años. El es un joven que presta sus servicios a una empresa  distribuidora de golosinas y se dedica a la venta de estos productos en forma ambulante abasteciendo la necesidad de productos de diferentes tiendas y mercados  de su municipio y sus alrededores, es así como el obtiene sus ingresos económicos que le permiten suplir las necesidades básicas del hogar. David solicita un crédito  a FUSAI para poder invertir en: ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena, grava, pintura, etc., para poder pintar las paredes de su casa y colocar ladrillo de piso en el área del corredor y lavadero, y de esta manera mejorar su vivienda y al mismo tiempo las condiciones de vida de su familia quienes son lo más importante para él.
texts.en:
David is 25 years old and lives with his family, which consists of his parents and his 21-year-old wife. David is a young man who works for a company that distributes candy. He works selling these products door to door to various stores and markets in his surrounding municipalities. In this way he earns money to support his family's needs. 

David is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to be able to invest in brick for flooring, cement, sand, gravel, paint, etc. in order to be able to paint the walls of his of his house, lay a brick floor in the hallway and wash room. In this way, he will improve his home and, at the same time, the quality of life of his family, who are the most important to him.

loans.use: to buy brick for flooring, cement, sand, gravel, paint, etc.

loans.name: Sangwera

texts.en:
Everline is 42 years old and married to Joseph, and she supports three children. She has been selling tomatoes to her clients for the last eight years and the business earns her 6,000 KES per month.

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more stocks of tomatoes for sale to her clients, in order to meet both client and family needs. 

In the future, she plans to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to sell milk to clients and repay the loan. Her hope is to be financially stable and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of tomatoes to sell to clients, to meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en:
Hezron is aged 55 years. He is married to Jane, and he supports 5 children. He has been a farmer for the last 20 years, and the business earns him 10,000 KES per month. 

Hezron has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya in order to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and fungicides which will enable him to grow a better harvest. He will use his harvest for both his family and also to sell the surplus in the market.

Hezron plans to use the profits to purchase a dairy cow so he can sell milk to clients. He also will use the profits to educate his children. 

Hezron hopes to expand his agriculture business and eradicate poverty in his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and fungicides which will enable him to grow a better harvest.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 49 years old and he supports five children. 

He has been a shopkeeper for the last 19 years and the business earns him 10,000 KES per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more stocks of goods and products such as sugar, sodas, and bread to sell to clients, to meet both client and family needs. 

He plans to use his gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to sell to clients, and to educate his children. 

His hope is to expand his business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of goods and products such as sugar, sodas, and bread to sell to clients, to meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 53 years old.

Evelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 44 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like detergent soap, bread, coffee, canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Nancy has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, bread, coffee, canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future Nancy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like detergent soap, bread, coffee, canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila  is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a farming rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming rice business.

Mila  has been in this business for 13 years. Mila  earns more income from general store.

Mila  has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Babejane

texts.en:
Babejane is 32 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Babejane is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Babejane has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia works hard to support her family. Marcia is married and has a selling seedlings business in the Philippines.

Marcia requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other materials for her business.

Marcia has been in this business for 4 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marcia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other materials for her business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with two children. With one child in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 35 years old and married with one child.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like school supplies, home care products etc. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from charcoal vending.

Marilyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like school supplies, home care products etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Josefina works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Josefina is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy garments and other materials needed for her business for her tailoring business.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy garments and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 42 years old and married, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of coffee, milk, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc.

Dionesia has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of coffee, milk, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Maria Eulotina

texts.es:
María, de 61 años de edad, es una mujer muy educada y trabajadora, se caracteriza por  su alto servicio a los demás, carece de estudios, ya que la mayor parte de su vida la dedicó a los quehaceres del hogar, su familia está formada por su esposo y sus tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad.
 
María, tiene 10 años de experiencia en la venta de granos básicos y productos de primera necesidad, también ha trabajado en un taller de corte y confección, de esa manera ayuda económicamente a su familia.

El dinero del préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar más granos básicos, porque en esta época los puede adquirir a un precio bajo y de esa manera obtener un mayor margen de ganancia a la hora de venderlos.

Los sueños de María, son mejorar su vivienda, mejorar y ampliar su negocio y también colocar una pupuseria, porque cuenta con la experiencia y los utensilios para dicha actividad.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 61 years old, is a very well-mannered and hard-working woman. She is characterized by her high level of service to others. She lacks schooling, since she has dedicated the greater part of her life to household tasks. Her family is formed by her husband and their three children, who are already adults.

Maria has 10 years of experience in selling basic grains and products of primary necessity. She has also worked in a dressmaking workshop. In this way she helps her family economically.

The money from the loan that she is applying for is to purchase more basic grains, because in this season she can acquire them at a low price and in this way obtain a greater profit margin when she sells them.

Maria's dreams are to improve her home, improve and expand her business, and also set up a pupuseria [pupusas are a traditional food of El Salvador], because she has the experience and the utensils for this business.

loans.use: to buy more basic grains

loans.name: Sarana

texts.en:
Sarana is 44 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

Sarana has been in this business for five years. 

In the future Sarana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Rrok

texts.en:
Rrok is been photographed with the vehicle he uses for transportation of building materials, in order to earn an income. He wants to tint the glass and do some major repairs to it and this is the reason why he is requesting this loan that will be his first one. 

Rrok who is 52 and lives in the northern part of the country, is married and has two children; one in the early 20s and one in the mid teens. Livestock and transportation have been the activities that he has been practicing on for all these past fifteen years. 

At the moment, he's got a cow from which he receives about 15 kg of raw milk a day for nine months a year. In the land he owns, he plants mainly corn and fodder for the cow. In addition to all these, he has planted apple orchards in four dynym land, but he's hasn't received any apple fruits yet, because they need more time to grow.

loans.use: to do some major repairs to the transportation vehicle he uses it to earn an income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, printing machine,

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a cheerful girl who was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1984.  She is single. Her right hand is disabled and she is left handed. She writes beautifully and accurately. 

She finished her studies at school with excellence and entered the university. She is one of the most active and talented students there.  She is in her third year and has a dream to be a teacher and her dream is coming true soon. 

She already gets practice at secondary school of her village, teaching pupils. She appealed to IMON asking financial support to pay her studies. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders compassion.

loans.use: to pay her studies

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is aged 55 years, married to Yobensia and he supports 5 children. 

He has been a farmer for the last 36 years and the business earns him KES 8,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and fungicides so as to enable him get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market and meet both client and family needs. 

He plans to gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sell to clients and educate his children. 

His hope is to expand his agricultural sector and improve sanitation.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and fungicides so as to enable him get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market .

loans.name: Lucilyn

texts.en:
Lucilyn works hard to support two children. She is married and has a weaving business in the Philippines.

Lucilyn requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend ther business hours even after nightfall.

Lucilyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena works hard to support her family. Elena is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase boxes of fresh fish to make dried fish.

Elena has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fresh fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Diona

texts.en:
Diona is single and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Diona requested a 1,800 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Diona is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks and hazards to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Tito

texts.es:
Tito utiliza los créditos como una herramienta valiosa para seguir teniendo su negocio con vida, puede satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas, etc.,  le permitirá tener nueva mercadería para atender mejor a sus clientes, espera que las ventas se mantengan y así tener recursos económicos con los que respaldara los pagos de la cuota de la nueva deuda.
texts.en:
Tito uses his loans as a valuable tool to keep his business going. He is able to satisfy the needs of his clients and generate income to support his family. 

He is asking for a new loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, etc., which will allow him to have new merchandise to better serve his clients. He hopes he can maintain sales so that he has the income to make payments on the new loan.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, etc. and have new merchandise to better serve his clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, wood, oil, lime, and other materials to continue making pupusas and tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gogarma Village. Dauda joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Dauda suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Dauda has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 50 bags of maize this year, Dauda can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Hysen

texts.en:
Hysen, shown in the picture above, is literally 'a poor and exhausted villager' as per his statement. He is also is a father to 7 children. He is 58 years old, and he wants to buy a dairy cow. 

For the past 15 years, Hysen has been raising livestock and practicing agriculture for a living. All in all, he has one dairy cow, one horse, and one mule. He also plants 7 dynym of land with barley, 3 dynym with wheat, 2 dynym with corn, and in his 3 other dynym of land, he has planted plum orchards. 

In addition to selling whatever products he makes from his activity, he also takes care of his wife who has medical problems. Thus, because she receives a disability income, he receives an income for taking care of her.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Celio Antonio

texts.es:
Celio, se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijoles, trabaja de forma independiente desde hace más de 15 años con un horario de seis de la mañana a doce meridiano, aprendió el oficio de sus padres y ya tiene mucha experiencia, vive con su linda familia integrada por su esposa y un hijo de dos años de edad, no tiene ayuda económica de familiares.
Necesita de un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, insecticidas y semilla mejorada, para poder realizar en esta temporada la siembra de granos básicos, espera obtener una cosecha abundante y de mucha calidad, de esta manera podra satisfacer a sus clientes, aumentara sus ventas e ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Su visión es ampliar su negocio con la incorporación de cultivos de hortalizas y tener recursos económicos para que su hijo estudie en la universidad.
texts.en:
Celio raises corn and beans. He has worked independently for more than 15 years, with a schedule from 6 in the morning to 12 noon. He learned this work from his parents, and he now has a lot of experience. He lives with his beautiful family consisting of his wife and a two-year-old son. He doesn't have economic help from relatives.

He needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, insecticides, and improved seed in order to be able to plant basic grains for this season. He hopes to obtain an abundant and high-quality harvest. In this way he will be able to satisfy his customers, and he will increase his sales and income to meet his obligations.

His vision is to expand his business by including vegetable crops and to have economic resources so that his son can study at the university.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, insecticides, and improved seed so that he can plant basic grains for this season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory and goods to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hair cutting machines and detergents so as to offer better and faster services to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Leatuolo

texts.en: Leatuolo is a 34-year-old mother with three children. She has a small business sewing clothes and selling them in her community. Leatuolo requested a loan to buy rolls of material, needles, a sewing machine and tape measure to help her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy rolls of material, needles, a sewing machine and tape measure

loans.name: Failelua

texts.en:
Failelua is 28 years old with 4 children. She runs a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. Failelua requested for a loan to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, to assist her run the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2014, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is aged 39 years, married to Mercyline and he supports six children.He has been offering motorcycle transport services to clients for the last 20 years and the business earns him KES 6,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as engine, piston and tyre for repair and maintenance so as to offer better services to clients. 

He plans to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to sell milk to clients who have increased in number in the region.His hope is to be financially stable and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as engine, piston and tyre for repair and maintenance so as to offer better services to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as chains, seat and tabulator so as to offer better and faster transport services to clients.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly works hard to support seven children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jelly requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Jelly is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 39 years old and married. She has five children, three of whom are in school. Belen works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar and eggs. Belen has been in this business for six years.

In the future Belen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar and eggs

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 27 years old, married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rona has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Rona requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Rona has been in this business for four years. In the future, Rona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle works hard to support her family. Michelle is married and has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Michelle has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Michelle would like to save money to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Prendë

texts.en:
Prende is in the mid fifties and a divorced mother of two; kindly note that the divorce rate among the Catholic community of northern Albania, where she belongs to, is the lowest in the country. Here it is what Prende said during the interview: 

"my marriage was very abusive in every way and I knew I had to get out of it so that the children could have the opportunity to grow in a better environment. So, I'm glad i did. Both of my kids grew up very healthy and have turned out to be great kids to me and to others. For me though, it was a struggle, especially financially. As for the loneliness that was another thing, but i dealt with it," she said smiling.

For 20 years, Prende has been operating the clothing store as seen in the picture and she now wants to stock up inventory items for it and this is where your loan will be used for.

loans.use: to operate a clothing store and she needs to buy inventory for it

loans.name: Gjin

texts.en:
This is a big happy family, from what we see in the picture. Gjin and Leze are parents to seven children, yet in the picture are only the ones below the teen age; the oldest two, a 19 and 15 felt uneasy to be in the picture. 

Gjin who is the father is 43 years old and the reason he is seeking your compassion and understanding is to pay about 200,000 Albanian Lek to the people who built a little home for the family of nine. 

"We suffered a shortage of money while we were building the house, but we had no choice but to continue building it because the children were literally sleeping in the cold. We then made an agreement with the builders to pay them as soon as we made little cash from the rural activity, but again, the money was not enough, because we had to feed seven children," said Leze to the loan officer. 

Currently their activity includes having 3 dairy cows, 17 beehives, 10 goats and 2 sows. His wife and the 19-year-old son collect sage and sell it for cash, while the 18-year-old daughter works in a nearby fish factory.

loans.use: to pay the house builders who completed his house so his family had somewhere to live

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wheat flour, eggs, margarine, fried oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is aged 28 years,married to Serah and he supports 3 children. 

He has been offering motorcycle transport services to clients for the last 2 years and the business earns him KES 3,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as chains, seat and tabulator so as to offer better and faster transport services to clients. 

He plans to gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sell to clients and educate his children. 

His hope is to expand his business sector and be self reliant.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as chains, seat and tabulator so as to offer better and faster transport services to clients.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old. He is not married with  children. He has had a motorcycle business for one years. 

He will be using the loan to purchase spare parts and hopes this will help him open another business. His hopes and dreams for the future are have many businesses and live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorbikes to help him open another business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is aged 36 years and he supports 4 children.  He has been a farmer for the last 4 years and the business earns him KES 3,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest and meet both client and family needs. 
 
He plans to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to sell milk to clients who have increased in number in the region and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is aged 37 years, married to Miriam and he supports 5 children. He has been a carpenter for the last 16 years and the business earns him KES 5,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase timber, chisel and saw for making furniture to sell to client and meet both family and client needs. 
 
He plans to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to sell milk to clients and expand his agricultural projects. 

His hope is to be financially stable and expand both his carpentry and agricultural sectors.

loans.use: to purchase timber, chisel and saw for making furniture to sell to client and meet both family and client needs.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is aged 43 years, married to Ann and he supports 5 children.  He has been selling construction materials for the last 24 years and the business earns him KES 6,200 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase wheelbarrow for transporting his construction materials to the nearest areas and meet constructors' demands. 

He plans to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to sell milk to clients who have increased in number in the region and purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest. 

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his business sector.

loans.use: to purchase wheelbarrow for transporting his construction materials to the nearest areas and meet constructors' demands.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has been working for iSmart Kenya for one month. She is a mother of six and started working at iSmart so that she could have a stable income to support her family and pay for her children's school fees.  

She is kind, friendly, and outgoing  - all qualities that make a great sales woman.  In her first two weeks she was able to sell more clean cookstoves than anyone else in her class.  Please help Esther earn a living and support her family by funding this loan on Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is 59 years old with 5 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. 

Epenesa requested for a loan to buy wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling),

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Magret is aged 44 years married to Nahashon and she supports 4 children.  She has been keeping and selling poultry for the last 15 years and the business earns her KES 6,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a hatching machine so as to hatch more chicks for sale to clients and meet both family and client needs. 

She plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and purchase farm inputs for a better harvest for family use. 
Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase a hatching machine so as to hatch more chicks for sale to clients and meet both family and client needs.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 28 years old. He is married with one child. He is a shoes retailer, a business he has been doing for the last 5 years and it has been profitable. 

Charles has asked for a loan from VisionFund Kenya which he will be using to purchase additional pairs of ladies and children shoes. 

With the anticipated profits, Charles will be able to pay school fees for his children.

His hopes and dreams for the future are have a stable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pairs of ladies and children shoes

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 47years old, married and supports a family of 4 children.  He has been operating in motorcycle for the last 20 years earning KES 20,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production for the family and to supply in the area for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production for the family and to supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is aged 39 years married to Joseph and she supports 5 children. She has been a dairy farmer for the last 5 years and the business earns her KES 24,000 per month.
 
She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily and meet their needs and those of her family. 

She plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and purchase farm inputs for a better harvest for family use. 
Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily and meet their needs and those of her family.

loans.name: Andrea De Jesus

texts.es:
Andrea, de 32 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta noveno grado, no continuo estudiando debido a la falta de recursos económicos, está casada y tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 2 años de edad, de los cuales solo uno se encuentra estudiando.

Andrea, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja como vigilante, mientras que Andrea, de lunes a viernes se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y los sábados y domingos se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante, este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 3 años y lo aprendió por la necesidad de ayudarle a su familia en los gastos de la casa.

Andrea, solicita el crédito para comprar más ropa para ofrecerle a sus clientes, de esa manera lograra obtener más ingresos, para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Andrea, es comprar su propia vivienda, para darle una mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Andrea is 32 years old and is a stay-at-home mom. She studied until the ninth grade and did not continue studying because of a lack of financial resources. She is married with two children ages 15 and 2, one of whom is studying.
Andrea lives with her husband and two children. Her husband works as a security guard, while Andrea spends Monday to Friday at home doing household chores and on Saturday and Sunday she works selling clothing by travelling. She has done this work for three years and she learned how to do it because of the need to help her family with the expenses of the home. 
Andrea is requesting this loan in order to buy more clothing to offer to her customers and in this way earn more income in order to give her family a better quality of life.  
Andrea's dream is to buy her own home to make her family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Nyambunde

texts.en:
Nyambunde is aged 59 years married to Joseph and she supports 5 children. She has been selling maize grains in the market for the last 24 years and the business earns her KES 4,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase stocks of maize grains for sale to clients and meet their demands and those of her family. 

She plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and purchase farm inputs for a better harvest for sale to clients. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business sector.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize grains for sale to clients and meet their demands and those of her family.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar  is 34 years old, married woman, with 4 children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Kousar  expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom  is 50 years old; she is a married woman.  She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 50000  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en:
Rozina  is 43 years old, married woman. She is been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases variety of cloth at low prices from city market and sells them in her own town. 

She has a strong customer base. Rozina  has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR. She wants to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen  is 46 years old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling clothes. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Perveen  is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. 

Currently she needs a loan of 50000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is aged 40 years,married to Everline and he supports 4 children.  He has been selling bricks for the last 15 years and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase wheelbarrows for transporting bricks to nearest areas so as to meet constructors needs and those of his family. 

He plans to gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sell to clients and educate his children. 

His hope is to expand his business sector and improve sanitation.

loans.use: to purchase wheelbarrows for transporting bricks to nearest areas so as to meet constructors needs and those of his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest for both family and client needs.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
He is 51 years old,married and blessed with five children and four adults.He has borrowed loan to purchase farm inputs. He hopes that this will help his generate income.

His hopes and dreams are to educate his children, purchase food for the family and expand the current business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops for a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus to clients in the market.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 28 years old man. He is married with two children. He operates a cafe and has been in the business for 12 years. 

This is his second loan with Vision fund. He will use the loan to buy food supplies - cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour, tea leaves, beans, cow peas etc. He will use anticipated profit from the business to pay school fees for his children and increase business operating capital. 

His hopes and dreams for the future is to have a cafe with a high source of income to meet his family needs comfortably.

loans.use: to buy food supplies cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour, tea leaves, beans, cow peas etc

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 39 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Estrella works very hard to provide for them.

Estrella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Estrella has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Estrella would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert aged 56 years is married with 8 children where 6 attend school at the moment. He does ground nuts trading as his major source of income. This he started because there were the groundnuts in the area. He has applied for a loan of ugx5,000,000 (Five million shillings only) to buy ground nuts for trading.  
He started his business in the year 1980 with high hopes of earning income to cater for his family needs. He also does coffee trading and agriculture to supplement on his monthly income. His business is located in his local cell of residence Kinyimi and his clients are people in Bushenyi district. 

He is a hard working man who works 9 hours a day and 6 days a week. He is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations but has learned to manage it. He hopes to become financially stable and expand his business in future.

loans.use: To boost his ground nuts trade business by buying more stock of the same for sell

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is 46 years old, married woman, with 4 children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Azra  expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat  is 41 years old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Nusrat ’s job is to look after the buffalos and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. 

However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Nusrat  has requested for 40000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 12 pigs and feed meal.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is aged 30 years,married to Risper and he supports 4 children. He has been a farmer for the last 3 years and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and herbicides so as to enable him get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market and meet both client and family needs. 

He plans to gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sell to clients and educate his children. 

His hope is to expand his business sector and eradicate poverty in his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and herbicides so as to enable him get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is a 46 year old mother with 9 children, she runs a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. 

Akenese requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags, to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags,

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is aged 23 years, married to David and she supports four children.She has been selling charcoal to clients for the last 8 years and the business earns her KES 6,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more stocks of charcoal for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs. 

She plans to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to sell milk to clients and repay the loan.Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business sector.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of charcoal for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Nemuel

texts.en:
Nemuel is aged 38 years,married to Mary and he supports 7 children. He has been a farmer for the last 5 years and the business earns him KES 12,000 per month.
 
He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and herbicides so as to enable him get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market and meet both client and family needs. 

He plans to gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sell to clients and educate his children. 

His hope is to expand his business sector and improve sanitation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and herbicides so as to enable him get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and married with four children. Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store  for 18 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Evelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 59 years old with one child. Florentina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Florentina has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Florentina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Jene

texts.en:
Jene is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jene is 37 years old and has three children who are in school. Jene has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. Jene requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like perfume, lipstick, etc..

Jene has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Jene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like perfume, lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is 23 years old with one child. Monaliza works very hard to provide for her child.

Monaliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as candles, peanuts, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

Monaliza has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Monaliza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as candles, peanuts, junk food, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 59 years old and married with one child. Norma works hard to provide for her family. 

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as biscuits, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Norma has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Norma aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as biscuits, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Paz works hard to support her family.

Paz has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Paz is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for food production in her food vending business.

Paz successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Paz has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jhoana

texts.en:
Jhoana is 34 years old with three children.Jhoana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Jhoana has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store  for 1 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jhoana aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is 35 years old and has four children. Petronila is married and has three children who are currently in school. Petronila is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Petronila requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Petronila has been in pig fattening for 13 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Petronila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Karimi

texts.en:
Karimi is a farmer and salesperson who is connected to many actors in the agricultural food chain. She makes income from mixed farming and through engaging in cereal trade as a broker.

She owns a 1-acre farm which she has made good use of by keeping 2 dairy cows and 15 heads of poultry. To generate extra income, she helps to arrange logistics of getting cereal produce from local farmers to their buyers in urban markets.

Given that Karimi is well connected and can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and to use her better understanding of market conditions and prices to sell cereal at a profit. Her role helps local farmers to focus on production, rather than sales.

Your loan will help Karimi to make bigger returns from her business and take better care of her family's basic needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, Charles started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Sondu, a remote village in the Kericho area of Kenya. Today, this humble and honest father sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. He is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge he has of farming, he commands a lot of respect from other farmers in his village. 

Dairy farming is close to his heart. Every day he wakes up to milk his cow and that makes him very proud. Although he makes profits through milk selling, he lacks a proper dairy unit. He is kindly seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. A good dairy unit provides a place where cows can relax and also protects them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Charles believes that, with this loan, his living conditions will change because he is going to have an increase in milk production. He will save money that he used to spend on treating his cows because he lacked a good dairy unit. Charles waits for your kindness.

Charles wish to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two dairy cows and grow potatoes.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 49 years old, married and had children to educate that is why he is very eager to gain income to sustain them. He is raising hogs for sale upon achieving its desired weight. 

He wants to keep ensuring good growth and nutrition to hogs that is why he is now asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy feeds and medicines for hogs sustenance. He hopes to continue improving his business for better income and continue educating his children.

loans.use: to buy feeds and medicines for hogs sustenance

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru:
Шахло молодая женщина из района Шахринав. Ей 34 года. Шахло гордо носит статус жены, матери и мастерицы. Шахло воспитанием детей занимается одна. Ее муж на заработках в Российской Федерации. Так же она успевает и зарабатывать. Она не зарабатывает не много, но достаточно, чтобы купить детям игрушки. 
  На сегодняшний день, швейная машинка Шахло сломалась и она не может продолжить шить. Она не хочет останавливать работу и обращается за финансовой поддержкой, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку. Шахло будет признательна, если ей помогут.
texts.en: Shahlo is a young woman from the Shahrinav district. She is 34 years old, and is proud to be a wife, mother, and craftsperson. Shahlo cares for her children alone, as her husband works abroad in Russia. She also makes time to earn a living - it's not much, but enough to buy the children toys. The sewing machine she has been using is broken, leaving her unable to sew. She doesn't want to stop working so she is asking for financial assistance to buy a new sewing machine. She will be grateful for the help.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy heads up for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. 

She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer of which she applied a loan from the Cooperative. Joy hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Nerie

texts.en:
Nerie is 45 years old and has four children. Nerie is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Nerie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Nerie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nerie has been in pig fattening for 11 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Nerie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Dukorerehamwe Group

texts.fr:
Germaine  fait partie du groupe  Dukorerehamwe  et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 53 ans et est marié à Venant, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de  7 à  24 ans tous étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de chèvres  depuis 8 ans. 

Elle est à son vingt-deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de chèvres   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait acheter un terrain cultivable et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Germaine is a member of the Dukorerehamwe group and lives in Gitega. [She] is 53 years old and married to Venant, a farmer. Together they have six children ranging from 7 to 24 years of age, all of whom are students.

Germaine  has been selling goats for eight years. She is on her 22nd loan with Turame. Thanks to her Kiva loan, she will bolster her capital and buy more goats for resale in order to increase her earnings. In the years to come,  Germaine would like to buy land for growing crops and provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more goats for resale so as to increase her earnings.

loans.name: Carmenchita

texts.en:
Carmenchita works hard to support five children. She is married and has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines.

Carmenchita requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is buying the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Carmenchita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 51 years old and has five children who are in school.

Jocelyn has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mabel Lizeth

texts.es:
Mabel, vende pan dulce y francés, ella elabora el producto y su esposo sale a venderlo en los alrededores de su localidad, de esta manera obtienen los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, vive con su esposo de 48 años de edad y sus hijos de 20, 15 y 7 años de edad, todo la familia colabora en el negocio.
El capital que solicita le será de ayuda para pagar un pedido que incluye harina, aceite, manteca, levadura, etc., tendrá materia prima para elaborar la venta de pan dulce y francés, espera atender las demandas de sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias.
Sus sueños son tener una mejor situación financiera y que sus hijos tengan un mejor desarrollo en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Mabel sells sweet and French bread. She bakes the product and her husband goes out to sell it in the areas around their home. In this way they earn the income necessary to cover the costs of their home. 
She lives with her husband, who is 48 years old and their children who are 20, 15 and 7 years old. The entire family helps in the business. 
The loan that she is requesting will help pay for an order that includes flour, oil, butter, yeast, etc., which are the basic ingredients for making sweet and French bread to sell. She hopes to meet the requests of her customers and increase her earnings.
Her dreams are to have a better financial situation and that her children will have a better position in society.

loans.use: to pay for an order that includes flour, oil, butter, yeast, etc., which are the basic ingredients for making sweet and French bread to sell.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо замужняя женщина в возрасте 55 лет. У нее двое детей. Ее муж работает поваром, а она дома готовит сметану и кефир на продажу. Она занята этой деятельностью около 15 лет. Зулайхо довольно известная личность в маленьком районе Дж.Руми своими домашними молочными продуктами. Зулайхо решила отремонтировать дом. Она посчитала, но из семейных бюджет не позволяет купить достаточное количество стройматериалов и начать ремонт. Она приняла решение и обратилась за заемными средствами с надеждой та то, что ей помогут.
texts.en: Zulaykho is a 55 year old married woman. She has two children. Her husband works as a cook, and at home she prepares sour cream and kefir for sale. She has been doing this work for around 15 years and is well known in the small J. Rumy district for her homemade products. Zulaykho has decided to renovate her house. She has calculated that she doesn't have enough funds in the family budget to buy the needed materials and begin repairs. She decided to seek out a loan, and hopes that you will help her.

loans.use: tO buy construction materials and do home renovations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel is 39 years old and married with two children; one child is still in school. Razel works very hard to provide for them.

Razel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and personal care products.

Razel has been in this business for two years. 

Razel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and personal care products

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en:
Gregory is a rural smallholder crop farmer in  Kitale area of Kenya. He is married and has 9 children to look after.  Besides crop farming, Gregory also does dairy farming for extra income.  The key lesson he has taken away from 40 years of being in crop farming is predicting weather patterns and using high quality farm inputs for better yields.

Gregory is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity.
With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Gregory’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jovelyn requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking female entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell at her store.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Rosita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell at her store.

loans.name: Pheobe

texts.en:
Pheobe is a hardworking female entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like soap, milk, canned goods, etc., to sell at her store.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Pheobe dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like soap, milk, canned goods, etc., to sell at her store.

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
Her name is Rizza, and she is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Bernard and blessed with five children, one of whom is in high school, two of whom are in elementary school, and two who are not yet school age. With five children to feed, Rizza and her husband run two businesses. She has a backyard piggery where she appears in the photo. She also has a food vending business. As with a majority of Filipinos, most families struggle to make ends meet, but they are also resourceful enough and filled with faith that they can get through anything.

Rizza makes local rice cakes like "suman" (sweet steamed sticky rice wrapped in banana leaves), a favorite among Filipinos. She sells her rice cakes to her neighbors in her town. She also started to raise hogs in her backyard, and it is a profitable business. She is thankful that she was allowed to start another business to augment her family's income to support the needs of her family. 

She is now seeking your financial help for a loan of 10,000 PHP to add piglets to raise in her backyard. She will also use part of the loan to buy ingredients, such as sticky rice, coconut milk, and sugar, to make her native rice cakes to sell. She would be very grateful if you could grant her the funds she needs to sustain and grow her businesses. She is thanking God in advance for your support.

Rizza's precious dream is to build her piggery and someday put up a small eatery. She aims to send all her children to school to allow them better opportunities in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients used in cooking native cakes, and to purchase piglets for her piggery business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married with two children and is a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. Gloria supports her family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her daughter, Jeraldine, who is 16 years old and the first of two children in the family. Jeraldine is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in Hotel and Restaurant Management and is currently in the first year of this two-year program.

Gloria is borrowing 10,000 PHP to pay her daughter's tuition fees for the first semester of the 2015-2016 school year.

By earning an income when she graduates, Jeraldine plans to help her parents send her sibling to college.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, gravel, rebar, etc. to build a perimeter wall around his home

loans.name: Tunamarimwe Group

texts.fr:
Ildefonse fait partie du groupe Tunamarimwe  et  habite à Gitega. Il  a 54 ans et est marié à Marcelline. une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 19  a 27 ans, dont 4 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce des habits  depuis 8 ans. 

Il est à huitième    crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits   à revendre  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Ildéphonse is part of the group Tunamarimwe and lives in Gitega. He is 54 years old and married to Marcelline, a farmer. Together they have five children, aged 19 to 27, of whom four are students.

Ildéphonse has been doing commerce in clothing for eight years. 

He is on his 8th Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase a large amount of clothing to resell, so as to earn more.

In the years to come, he would like to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of clothing to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 65 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Juan se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Juan espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 65 years old, married, and lives with his wife in a rural area of the district of Cayaltí, which is located in Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on Peru's northern coast. The people who live in this district work primarily in farming, livestock, and trade.

Juan raises and sells small animals, such as chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, and others; his business is located in his own home. He has 15 years of experience in the business and very good personal and professional references in the area. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a larger quantity of animals, such as hens, ducks, turkeys, chickens, and others, as well as to buy feed for them. With this Juan hopes to offer a better product to his customers, which will allow him to generate more income and thereby increase his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals, such as hens, ducks, turkeys, chickens, and others, as well as to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.es: La señora Magnolia, es una persona de 22 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, pero vive en concubinato con el señor Raúl, alcanzo a estudiar el bachillerato en humanidades, cuenta con un dependiente económico a cargo el cual es su pequeño hijo y actualmente junto a su familia viven en el domicilio de un pariente suyo en calidad de cuidador la cual se halla situado en la ciudad de Cochabamba. La actividad económica que desarrolla la señora junto a su esposo es prestar servicios de transporte urbano con su propio vehículo (Taxi), cuenta con experiencia de un año y su esposo 7 años, el trabajo lo realizan diariamente generando un ingreso básico para sus gastos familiares. Finalmente la señora  Magnolia y su esposo manifiestan ser personas trabajadores y responsables es por ello que la señora Magnolia quiere solicitar un préstamo para  realizar la chapería general de su  vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo de tal manera se vea presentable para sus clientes pasajeros lo que les permitirá generar mejores ingresos para el sustento de su familia y a su vez mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Magnolia is 22 years old, is legally single but lives with her common-law husband Raul. She has obtained her secondary school education in humanities. She has a dependent in her care, her young son. Currently, along with her family, they live in the home of a caregiving relative located in the city of Cochabamba. 

The economic activity that Magnolia works in, alongside her husband, is providing urban transportation (taxi) services with their own vehicle. She has one year of experience, and her husband has 7 years, doing this daily work generating a basic income for family expenses. 

Lastly, Magnolia and her husband are hard-working, responsible people. It is for that reason that Magnolia would like to request a loan for general body work for her vehicle, which is the tool of her work, so that it looks presentable for her passengers. This will allow her to generate better income to support her family and in turn improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to complete body work on her taxi so that it looks presentable for her passengers and will also generate better income to support her family.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 63 years old and married with 14 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Nora has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Kenyera Group

texts.fr:
Concilie fait partie du groupe Kenyera  et  habite à Gitega. Il  a 53 ans et est mariée à Joseph, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  l’un a 8 ans et l’autre 25 ans, ils étudient tous. 
Il a sou sa charge  sa petite  fille qui étudie.

Il fait le commerce de bananes depuis 20 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes   à revendre  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait  faire de l’élevage en plus de son commerce et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Concilie is part of the group Kenyera and lives in Gitega. She is 53 years old and married to Joseph, a merchant. Together they have two children, 8 and 25 years old, both students. She has a student granddaughter in her care.

Concilie has been doing commerce in bananas for twenty years. 

She is on her 2nd loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of bananas to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to raise livestock in addition to her business and to see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of bananas to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of bananas to make beer to sell, so as to earn more.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
You can always see food vendors walking along the streets or just staying at one populous spot. Sometimes they are running when there are policemen pursuing them to get some fines.

Theresa from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo is chasing the crowd in order to get higher sales. She is vending “kwek-kwek”, a popular street food in the Philippines. It is made from boiled egg covered with flour, deeply fried and skewered on a bamboo stick. It is usually dipped in vinegar with fermented chili and pepper. It’s really an appetizing and saleable snack.

She earns enough to help sustain her family’s daily needs. But she can hardly afford the educational expenses of her children who are studying in high school and college. Her husband Ricardo is also running his own small enterprise and both of them patiently work hard for the sake of their children.

Theresa appeals for a PHP 20,000 loan to buy ingredients like eggs, flour, vinegar, and oil for her food vending business. Hopefully, she can earn a higher profit to sustain all their needs and also set aside some amount for the future. This may be one step forward in reaching her dream of renovating their house and having professional children.

Theresa is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like eggs, flour, vinegar, and oil for her food vending business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
A “sari-sari” or variety store appeals to customers if it has wide variety of selections.

This is the reason why Rosa wants to avail a PHP 22,000 loan to buy a volume of supplies like grocery items and dry goods. These additional stocks will enhance the competitiveness of her store within their community in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo.

She also plans to grill pork barbeque in front of her store every afternoon to augment her income. If her sari-sari and barbeque business will improve according to her plan, its income will contribute a lot in meeting her family’s basic needs and school expenses of her children who are studying in college and high school. She is lovingly supported by her husband Rosalino, a driver. They both work diligently to enrich their lives and prepare for the future.
