Rosa meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a volume of supplies like grocery items and dry goods.

loans.name: Johanna Carolina

texts.es:
Johana vive con sus hijos, su esposo, su mamá, una hermana y un sobrinito, pero soso sus hijos y su madrecita dependen de ella, Johana se dedica al cuido de sus hijos y a los quehaceres del hogar. 
El crédito que esta solicitando Johana en la institución es para pagar la reparación de una motocicleta en la que su esposo se desplaza para ir a trabajar y para andar vendiendo pan por las casas de la comunidad.
El sueño de Johana es comprar una vivienda para ella y su familia, ya que en la que viven es de uso mamá.
Glenda es una señora de 32 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta el 9° grado, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 4 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando, su esposo trabaja como vigilante en la platanera de la carrera desde hace 3 años, Glenda vive con su esposo y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Johana lives with her children, her husband, her mom, a sister, and a young nephew, but only her children and her mom depend on her. Johana looks after her kids and takes care of the household chores.

The loan Johana is requesting from the institution is to pay to repair a motorcycle her husband rides to go to work and to go out selling bread to the homes in the community.

Johana's dream is to buy a home for her and her family, as the one they live is in her mom's.

Glenda is a woman of 32; she is a homemaker; she has a ninth-grade education; she is married and has two children who are 11 and 4 years old and are in school; her husband has worked as a security guard at the banana plantation for three years; Glenda lives with her husband and their children.

loans.use: to repair a motorcycle

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn is grateful that she that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan which she helped fill her small store with essential grocery items. Anelyn values her business for this is her main source of income to support her family's needs and fund her children's education.

She has been operating her general store for five years already. She sells fresh, dry, and packaged goods, mostly essential household and food items. She is continuing her fish culture to augment their income. Like most Filipino mothers, Anelyn will do her best to help provide for the needs of her children.

She is now seeking for financial assistance to purchase additional grocery items such as instant noodles, canned goods, bread, beverages, and toiletries to sell at retail price. Part of the loan she will use to buy fish semen for fish culture. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. Her earnings will be a big help to cover their day to day needs and for her children's schooling.

Anelyn's simple dream is to grow her store into a big grocery store and see her children finish school. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Petronila

texts.es:
María, con la ayuda de créditos se mantiene trabajando para tener el sustento diario para su familia, todos se encuentran muy saludables y su situación económica está mejorando.
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar pan, aderezos, embutidos, gaseosas, jugos, etc., para elaborar la venta de hogt dog y panes con pollo, busca seguir progresando y atender mucho mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
With the help of these loans María is able to keep working so she can provide for her family's daily needs; they are all very healthy and their financial situation is improving.

She is requesting a new loan to buy bread, dressings, cold cuts, soft drinks, juices, etc. to keep up her business selling hot dogs and chicken sandwiches; she wants to keep improving and provide her customers with much better service.

loans.use: to buy bread, dressings, cold cuts, soft drinks, juices, etc. to keep up her business selling hot dogs and chicken sandwiches.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Buy-and-sell enterprise is simply understood as buying products at a low price and selling the same products at a higher price. The difference between the two costs will be the entrepreneur’s profit. The products may range from cheap rags to expensive condominiums or houses and lots, depending on the entrepreneur’s capital.

Adora from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo, is doing buy-and-sell of various products such as toiletries, laundry needs, cleaning materials, and some school supplies. She has contact dealers from whom she can get the products at lower prices. She will then sell the products directly to her friends, neighbors, relatives and other network.

To her advantage, she chooses the products that do not decay or rot. But the disadvantage is – she has no place to display her products, so she carries them from house to house. She braves the rain and heat of the sun to earn substantial income. Now she plans to take more orders from her customers and deliver the products afterwards.

With this method she can avoid carrying heavy loads on her shoulders because she will only carry pre-ordered products, but she has to be ready for whatever order and quantity that her customers will demand from her. This is the reason why she would like to borrow supplementary capital amounting to PHP 20,000. Hopefully her request will be granted soon.

Adora is a widow but her children are no longer dependent on her. Nevertheless, they are still part of her dream to have a comfortable life someday. She is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products for her buy and sell home products business.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is a 69-year-old widow, has three children of adult age and lives in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC where she enjoys all the benefits given to clients like her. 

Aside from her pension, she is supported with their mini grocery store and rice farm where she and her late husband had invested before. 

Gertrudes is thankful to the cooperative because she can always turn to it whenever she needs financial assistance. Currently, she avails herself of another loan of 20,000 PHP to pay for a medical check-up and to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check-up and purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Rebella

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rebella works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Rebella is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy plastic rope and empty bottles and to pay for the labor for her seaweed culture business.

Rebella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic rope and empty bottles and to pay for the labor

loans.name: Fredis Orlando

texts.es:
Fredis, sigue ofreciendo el servicio de molino nixtamal, por la buena administración de los créditos y sus ingresos le permiten cumplir con sus responsabilidades.
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar un motor nuevo para el molino nixtamal atenderá con rapidez a sus clientes, espera tener buenos resultados como con el crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Fredis is still offering his services grinding nixtamal, or boiled corn; between managing his loans well and his earnings he is able to live up to his responsibilities.

He is requesting a new loan to buy a new motor for his nixtamal mill so he can provide his customers with fast service; he hopes to see good results as he did with his previous loan.

loans.use: to buy a new motor for his nixtamal mill so he can provide his customers with fast service; he hopes to see good results as he did with his previous loan.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla lives in a nearby university located on their locality. She took the opportunity to do business and ventures into opening an eatery and a boarding house wherein her primary clients are the students. 

Perla is 60 years old, married and has only one child of adult age. She signed up for a membership with the cooperative where she has access to various services it offers to members like her. Recently, she has availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of cement and plywood for boarding house repair.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and plywood for boarding house repair

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
It’s not always easy to run a “sari-sari” (variety) store. Erlinda, 66, wakes up very early in the morning and sleeps late at night in order to meet the demands of customers. It’s a good thing that her husband, Johnny, lovingly assists her throughout the day. They have been operating this business for 10 years and it helped a lot in their usual everyday necessities. 

However, their income is not enough to set aside some savings as they age. Now that Erlinda and her husband are already at their old age, they still want to improve their business. Erlinda is longing to have additional capital of PHP 15,000 that she will use to buy more grocery items and beverages. She’s aiming that she can save some amount from the additional income that will be derived from these goods. She can use the savings as an emergency fund in case she or her husband gets sick. 

She dreams of a longer, happy life without serious illness. She is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty, and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items and beverages

loans.name: Azeem

texts.en:
Azeem is 46 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. 

She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of manufactured hairpieces, a blow dryer and hair conditioner for making her clients beautiful as she meet their demands.

loans.name: Elmelda

texts.en:
Elmelda is aged 39 years and she supports six children. 

She has been a dairy farmer for the last four years, and the business earns her KES 5,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the number of liters of milk supplied to clients daily. 

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate her kids. 

Her hope is to expand her agricultural sector and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the number of liters of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Lotovale

texts.en:
Lotovale is 21 years old and single. She runs a small business of selling cabbages, cucumbers and eggplant in her village to earn a living. 

Lotovale requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber and eggplant), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, chemicals and hand gloves to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, chemicals and hand gloves.

loans.name: Glenda Carolina

texts.es:
Glenda, de 32 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 4 años de edad los cuales están estudiando y su esposo trabaja como vigilante en una plantación de plátanos que está a la orilla de la carrera desde hace 3 años.

Glenda, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar a sus hijos.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar medicamentos para su hijo porque está enfermo, esto le ayudará porque podrá darle a su hijo el medicamento para que se sienta mucho mejor.

El sueño de Glenda es, comprar una casa para sus hijos, ya que actualmente está viviendo en la casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
Glenda, 32 years old, is a housewife. She studied until the ninth grade. She is married and has two children, ages 11 and 4, who are studying. Her husband has worked for the last three years as a guard on a plantain plantation that is on the edge of the highway.

Glenda works doing household chores and caring for her children.

The loan she is requesting is to buy medicine for her son because he is sick. This will help because she will be able to give her son medicine so that he feels much better. 

Glenda’s dream is to buy a home for her children, since currently she is living in the house of her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her son because he is sick.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a woman, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling coconut wine in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Lorna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy bottles of coconut wine to sell for her business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bottles of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Lindana

texts.es:
Lindana, de 31 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta quinto grado, está soltera y es madre de 3 hijos de 3, 10 y 14 años de edad, de los cuales 2 están estudiando; ella vive con su mamá, una sobrina y sus hijos los cuales dependen de ella.

Lindana, trabaja en una cooperativa llama la carrera desde hace 14 años, trabaja en el horario de 6:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.

El credito que está solicitando es para comprar ganado para engordarlo y luego venderlo, para poder obtener ingresos para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Lindana, es comprar materiales de construccion para construir su propia vivienda y asi darle a sus hijos una mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Lindana, 31 years old, is a homemaker. She studied until the fifth grade. She is single and the mother of three children ages 3, 10, and 14, two of which are studying. She lives with her mother, a niece, and her children who depend on her.

Lindana has worked in a cooperative for 14 years. She works a schedule of 6:00am to 5:00pm.

The loan she is requesting is to buy cattle to fatten and later sell in order to obtain income to give her children a better quality of life.

Lindana’s dream is to buy construction materials to build her own home and in that way give her children greater comfort.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten and later sell.

loans.name: Renelie

texts.en:
Renelie is 50 years old and married with eight children, three of whom are presently in school, Renelie works very hard to provide for them.

Renelie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Renelie has been in this business for 20 years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Sirene

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Sirene works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of coco lumber business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Sirene is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more coco lumber to sell.

Sirene has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more coco lumber to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Vivian has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Vivian has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Vivian would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Susima

texts.en:
Susima is 46 years old and married with seven children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Susima is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pig.

Susima has been in this business for four years and earns additional income from buy and sell of ready to wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie works hard to support two children. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Elsie requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Elsie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 42 years old and has four children. She is married and two of her children are presently in school.

Virgie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Virgie requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Virgie has been in his business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and married with three children.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Vilma has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns an income from buying and selling personal collection products.

Vilma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn works hard to support four children. She is a widow and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Erlyn requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Erlyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old and has two children. Elizabeth is married and one of her children is in school.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business farming root crops in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elizabeth has been farming root crops for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Frenida

texts.en:
Frenida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of recycled materials business in the Philippines.

Frenida is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her business hours even after nightfall.

Frenida is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Warlita dreams that one day, she will be able to save money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement blocks, sand, iron, cement and more to continue building walls in her home.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia tiene 38 años de edad, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Amelia se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como vacas, cerdos, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como becerros, lechones, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Amelia espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Amelia is 38 years old and lives in the family house in a rural area of the Cayaltí district in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru's northern coast. The inhabitants of the district work mainly in farming, cattle-raising and trade.

Amelia herself makes a living raising and animals such as cows, pigs, ducks, turkey and more. Her business is located in her own home. She has five years' experience with the business, and very good personal and professional references locally.

Amelia will use this loan to buy more animals, such as pigs, chickens, and bullocks, as well as to buy animal feed. With this loan Amelia hopes to offer her customers better products, allowing her to earn a higher income and thus to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals, such as pigs, chickens, and bullocks, as well as to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase electrical appliances and electrical spare parts such as radios, mobile phones and televisions so he can always offer better services to his clients.

loans.name: Shurwe Group

texts.fr:
Mathieu  fait partie du groupe  Shurwe  et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 28 ans et est marié à Aline , une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants.

Il fait le commerce de  riz, de sorgho, …dans sa boutique  depuis 3 ans. 

Il  est à son  deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de sorgho et de riz   à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Mathieu is a member of the group Shurwe and lives in Gitega. He is 28 years old and married to Aline, a farmer. Together they have 2 children.


He has been seling rice and sorghum in his store for 3 years.


He is on his second loan at Turame. WIth the KIVA loan that he receives, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of sorghum and rice for resale to earn more.

loans.use: to increase his capital and to buy a large quantity of sorghum and rice for resale to earn a profit.

loans.name: Reme Group

texts.fr:
Roger  fait partie du groupe  Reme  et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 37 ans et est marié à Vincine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants âgés de  2 à  12 ans  dont 2 étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de pièce de rechange de vélo  depuis 9 ans. 

Il est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de pièces de rechange  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait inclure dans son commerce les pièces de rechange de motos  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Roger is a member of the group Reme and lives in Gitega. He is 37 years old and married to Vincine, a farmer. Together, they have 4 children ages 2 to 12 years old, with 2 in school.

He has been selling spare bicycles parts for 9 years.

He is on his third loan at Turame. WIth the KIVA loan he receives, he is going to increase his capital and buy a lot of spare parts for resale to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to include motorbike parts in his business and see his children in school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and to buy many spare parts for resale to earn a profit.

loans.name: Turwanubujuju Group

texts.fr:
Astérie fait partie du groupe Turwanyubujuju  et  habite à Gitega. Elle   a 28 ans et est mariée à Arcade. un  commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés  de 3 mois  à  7 ans. 

Elle fait le commerce de l’huile de palme  depuis 4 ans. 

Elle est à son sixième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’huile de palme   à revendre  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter une grande propriété foncière pour l’agro-élevage moderne.
texts.en:
Astérie is a member of the Turwanyubujuju group and lives in Gitega. She is 28 years old and married to Arcade, a businessman. Together they have 3 children ages 3 months to 7 years old.

She has been selling palm oil for 4 years.

She is on her sixth loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan that she receives, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil for resale to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a large property with land for modern agriculture and livestock farming.

loans.use: to increase her capital and to buy a large quantity of palm oil for resale to earn a profit.

loans.name: Las Gardenias De Jicamarca Group

texts.es: 5 mujeres  responsables de distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellas son las integrantes del grupo comunal “Las Gardenias de Jicamarca”, una de ellas es la Sra. Ester de 43 años de edad soltera  y con 2 hijos menores de edad, la Sra. Ester se dedica ya hace 2 años al negocio de venta de productos comestibles (golosinas, abarrotes, etc.), en un local que está ubicado en su propia casa donde labora todos los días,  la Sra. Ester  nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes lo cual a generando ingresos  para cubrir los gastos de su casa,  En el futuro le gustaría ampliar y modificar su negocio  y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más productos comestibles para abastecer su negocio y poder tener más ingresos. La Sra. Ester es la segunda de la mano izquierda se le distingue por su casaca jean de color azul. A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en:
These five responsible women work in different businesses.  They all are members of the communal bank "Las Gardenias de Jicamarca".  One of the members is Ester who is 43, single and has two minor children.  For two years she has been selling food (sweets, groceries, etc.) at the store set up in her own home where she works every day.

Ester says she has been able to establish loyal customers so with her income she is able to cover her household expenses.  In the future she wants to expand and modify her business in order to earn more profit.  

She will use the loan to buy more food products to stock her store and earn more income.

Esther is second from the left wearing a jean jacket.  She sends a hug to Kiva and promises to meet her goals.

loans.use: To buy goods for her business.

loans.name: Rumaldo

texts.es:
Rumaldo tiene 41 años de edad,conviviente vive con su conyuge y sus 04 hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Sallique que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Rumaldo se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de becerros, vacas, entre otros así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Rumaldo espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rumaldo, 41, lives with his common-law wife and his four children in a rural area of the district of Sallique which is located in the province of Jaen in the Cajamarca Region on the northern mountain range of Peru.  The locals of this district work mainly in agriculture, livestock farming and commerce.

Rumaldo raises and sells cattle and works from home.  He has ten years' experience in the business and good personal and work references.  The loan he is requessting is to buy more calves, cows and other livestock, as well as balanced animal feed.

By doing this, Rumaldo hopes to offer a better product to his customers which will increase his income and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more calves, cows and other livestock, as well as balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Isoko Group

texts.fr:
Révocate  fait partie du groupe Isoko  et  habite à Gitega. Elle   a 28 ans et est mariée à Almac. un  commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés  de  5  à  8 ans dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  bananes  depuis 4 ans. 

Elle est à son  quatrième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes    à revendre  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait acheter une chèvre pour l’élevage  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Révocate is a member of the group Isoko and lives in Gitega. She is 28 years old and is married to Almac, a businessman. Together they have 3 childen ages 5 to 8 years old, with two of them in school.

She has been selling bananas for 4 years.
She is on her fourth loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan that she receives , she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for resale to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a goat to raise and see her children in school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and to buy a large quantity of bananas for resale to earn a profit.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Don Pedro nació en el municipio de La Dalia. Recuerda el señor Pedro que a los 12 años empezó a trabajar en labores agrícolas en las tierras de su padre y en propiedades vecinas, a los 15 años  de edad se traslado a otra comunidad con sus padres y hermanos, el padre de don Pedro compro una propiedad en este lugar y así fue que desde 1975 vive en esta comunidad. El señor Pedro es casado y ha procreado 11 hijos, los mayores ya no viven con él por que ya se casaron y formaron su familia, solo viven los cuatro menores y están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad, el cual los apoya bastante para que estudien. El padre de don Pedro antes de morir le dio unas tierras y don Pedro había comprado otras con su trabajo y cuando se casó se fué a vivir a esas tierras, en la cual tiene sembrado café y lo maneja de manera orgánica, comenta que le gusta estar en armonía con el medio ambiente. Don Pedro aún tiene viva a su madre  y la visita día de por medio ya que vive cerca de donde él tiene la propiedad. Comenta don Pedro que en esta comunidad no hay luz eléctrica y se tiene que estar alumbrando con foco y candela pero quiere vivir diferente y es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y este será instalado en la casa de habitación para que alumbre y sirva de gran manera a los miembros del hogar, a los hijos que están estudiando les servirá bastante ya que se podrán alumbrar y hacer las tareas por las noches y la esposa se podrá levantar por las madrugadas para los tiempos de corte y hacer las comida para los cortadores, y don Pedro podrá despulpar su café por las noches alumbrándose con su panel solar, don Pedro estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad del préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en:
Pedro was born in the town of La Dalia.  He remembers that at age 12 he started working in agriculture on his father's land and on neighbors' land.  At age 15 he moved with his parents and siblings to another community.  His father bought land there and that is where he has lived since 1975.

Pedro is married and has 11 children.  The eldest no longer lives at home since they have married and formed their own families.  Only the youngest four live at home and attend the community school, with the support of their father.  Pedro inherited land from his father when he passed away, and he also bought land himself through his work, so when he got married he went to live there.  It is where he grows organic coffee and enjoys the harmony of the environment.

Pedro's mother is still alive and he visits her daily as she lives nearby.  He says there is no electricity in the community so lanterns and candles are what they use.  But he wants to lead a different life and therefore is requesting a loan to buy a solar system for his house to install lighting.  This will allow him to work at night and his wife will be able to get up early in the morning for harvest time and to make food for the harvesters.  Pedro will be able to remove coffee beans at night with the light from the solar panel.

Pedro is very grateful for this opportunity to buy a solar system.

loans.use: To install a 100-watt, 5 luminary solar energy system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens, animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Santos Marcelino

texts.es:
Santos tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, vive con su conyuge y sus dos hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Santos se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, cerdos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como pollos, cerdos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Santos espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 31 years old. He lives with his spouse and his two children in a rural area of the Pucara district, which is located in the Jaen province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. The people that live in this district work in commerce, agriculture, and livestock as their primary sources of income. 

Santos makes a living raising and selling small animals such as chickens and pigs, among others, and works at home. He three years' experience in this business as well as on very good personal and professional references from people in the area. He is requesting a loan to buy a more animals such as chickens and pigs, among others, and to buy balanced feed for these animals. 

With this, Santos hopes to offer his customers better products, which will allow him to increase his earnings and, therefore, to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To buy more animals such as chickens, pigs, etc., as well as balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Leidy Mabel

texts.es:
Leydi tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su conyugue y su hija en una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la Sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Leydi se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, cuyes, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cuyes, gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Leydi espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Leydi is 23 years old. She lives with her husband and her daughter in a rural area in the Santo Tomas district which is located in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region, in the northern ranges of Peru. Locals in this district make a living primarily from agriculture, farming and trade.

Leydi earns a living raising and selling small animals including chickens, ducks and turkeys, and she runs her business from her own home. She has years of experience in the business and she has good personal and professional references in her area. 

The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase a larger number of animals such as guinea pigs, hens, ducks, turkeys and roosters, as well as balanced feed for them. Through this, Leydi hopes to offer a better product to her customers which will allow her to improve her income and as a result increase her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of animals.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина 38 летняя женщина из маленького городка Вахдат. Она замужем. Ее муж фермер. Парвина сама занимается шитьем одежды. В браке у нее один ребенок. Ее мальчика зовут Камариддин. Парвина хочет с мужем решили отремонтировать дом и начали ремонтные работы, но им не хватило стройматериалов, чтобы завершить ремонт. Парвина решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы купить не достающие материалы и закончить ремонт. Она надеется, что ее поддержат, и она заранее благодарит Вас за помощь.
texts.en: Parvina is a 38-year-old woman from the small city of Vahdat.  She is married to a farmer.  Parvina herself sews clothes.  She has one child, named Kamariddin, from her marriage.  She and her husband have decided to renovate their house and have already started some construction work, but they don't have enough building supplies to complete their project.  For this reason, Parvina has decided to apply for a loan, which will help her to buy the supplies that she's missing.  She hopes to receive some support, and she thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and renovate her house.

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.ru:
Шафоат  позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Шафоат живёт в небольшом селе. Она очень любит свою семью. Она занимается куплей продажей женской одежды. 
Сейчас Шафоат имеет нужду. У них в доме не имеется холодильника, совсем недавно их старый холодильник сломался и не подлежит ремонту. Но сейчас в жаркое время без холодильника невозможно. А у Шафоат сейчас нет необходимой суммы денег для покупки холодильника, так как все средства она тратит на пропитание. Поэтому сейчас Шафоат обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку холодильника. Она очень надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Shafoat is a hardworking woman with a positive attitude in life.  She is married and the mother of five children.  She deeply loves her family and lives with them in a small village.  She makes a living from buying and selling women's clothes.  

Shafoat currently needs help: her family doesn't have a refrigerator at the moment, since their old fridge just broke down and is beyond repair.  As it is impossible to live without a fridge in the summer, Shafoat needs money to buy a new refrigerator.  However she spends all her earnings to feed her family.  For this reason, she has turned to MDO Arvand and requested a loan.  She is looking forward to a positive outcome.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Juan Gilberto

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre casado de 35 años de edad, vive junto a su linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 2 y 7 años. Esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Juan es un gran trabajador que se esmera día con día para darle a su familia lo necesario, el desde hace tres años es trabajador municipal en su comunidad, gracias a esta labor su familia cuenta con lo necesario, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también tiene un negocio de compra y venta de ropa típica.
Juan desde hace un tiempo ha tenido el anhelo de incrementar su negocio, a pesar de todo su esfuerzo realizado esto no ha sido posible, es la razón que lo motiva a él para solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de güipiles , fajas, cortes y todo lo relacionado con la línea de ropa. Juan tiene el sueño de incrementar su negocio para mejorar su ingreso.
texts.en:
Juan is a 35 year old married man, he lives with his beautiful family, consisting of two children aged between 2 and 7. The family live in a community in Sololá.

Juan is a hard worker who goes to a lot of effort day after day to give his family what they need. He has been a municipal worker in his community for three years, thanks to which his family has what they need, but to improve his income he also has a store buying and selling traditional clothing. 

For a while, Juan has been wishing to increase his business, but despite all his best efforts, this has not been possible. This is what has motivated him to request a loan, which he will use to buy güipiles, fajas and cortes, which are traditional Guatemalan woven blouses, belts and skirts, as well as other things related to clothing. Juan dreams of expanding his business to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old, is married and has six children.

Erlinda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Erlinda has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Virgie requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in the case of an emergency.

Virgie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 52 years old, married and has six children, two of whom are in school. Elvira is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elvira has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena es una mujer casada de 32 años de edad, ella vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de Nahualá, Magdalena tiene un hijo que estudia sexto primaria.
Magdalena es una mujer que lucha cada día para apoyar a su familia, pues desde hace 6 años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, le gusta hacer esta actividad ya que lo hace desde la comunidad de su hogar, y esto le permite también realizar los oficios de su casa y cuidar de sus hijos, con esta actividad ella contribuye con su esposo en complementar algunos gastos.
Magdalena con el afán de seguir comprando y vendiendo ropa típica, ella solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio, con este dinero ella estará comprando güipiles, cortes, fajas y todo lo relacionado con la línea de ropa. Magdalena tiene el sueño de instalar un local donde venda exclusivamente ropa típica.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a married woman aged 32. She lives with her family in a community in Nahualá, Magdalena has a child who is studying in the sixth grade.

Magdalena is a woman who fights every day to support her family, so six years ago she began to buy and sell traditional clothing. She likes this activity as she can do it from her home, and it allows her to take care of household chores and look after her children. With this work she is able to contribute with her husband to some of the household costs.

Fueled by her desire to continue buying and selling traditional clothing, Magdalena is requesting a loan to invest in her business. With this money she will buy traditional Guatemalan woven blouses, skirts and belts (güipiles, cortes and fajas) and other things related to clothing.

Magdalena dreams of setting up a shop from which she can exclusively sell traditional clothing.

loans.use: to buy traditional Guatemalan woven clothing: güipiles, cortes and fajas.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Jean is 48 years old and,  and two of her children are in school.

Mary Jean has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Mary Jean requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.  Mary Jean has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Mary Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jenessa

texts.en:
Jenessa is 26 years old and has four children. Jenessa is married, and two of her children are in school.

Jenessa is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Jenessa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.  Jenessa has been farming rice for two years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jenessa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 44 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Jocelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  Jocelyn has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merlina is 48 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Merlina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Merlina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  Merlina has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Merlina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, 30, is a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marilyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Marilyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, 47, is a married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marilyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 22 years.

Marilyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Con 64 años de edad Maria es una señora muy responsable y trabajadora, comenta María que se dedica a criar ganado desde que era muy joven, así que le va bien en este negocio ya que ella tiene sus vacas y por medio de la venta de la leche es como se ayuda económicamente, Maria tiene 4 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y que ya trabajan, Maria vive con su esposo que es jornalero, su hijo, nuera y 2 nietos, María con el crédito va a comprar una vaca para incrementar su negocio y por medio de este  aspira apoyarse en los gastos diarios para su familia.
texts.en:
Aged 64, Maria is a very responsible and hard working lady. 

María says that she has worked rearing cattle since she was very young, so with her cows, she is doing well with this business. She can support herself economically by selling the milk. 

Maria has four children who are now grown up and working, she lives with her husband who is a day laborer, as well as her son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. 

With this loan, María will buy a cow to expand her business and with this, she hopes to be able to support her family with the daily household costs.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Xejuyupenses. Group

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer soltera de 47 años de edad, ella vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de Nahualá, Antonia tiene 9 hijos de las edades entre 9 y 28 años.
Antonia (es la primera del lado derecho de la foto) es una mujer que lucha cada día para apoyar a su familia, pues desde hace 8 años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, le gusta hacer esta actividad ya que lo hace desde varios lugares circunvecinos de su comunidad, y esto le permite también realizar los oficios de su casa y cuidar de sus hijos con esta actividad ella contribuye con su familia con los gastos.
Antonia con el afán de seguir comprando y vendiendo ropa típica, ella solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio, con este dinero ella estará comprando güipiles, cortes, fajas y todo lo relacionado con la línea de ropa. Antonia tiene el sueño de instalar un local donde pueda exhibir mejor su producto.
texts.en: Antonia is a single, 47 year old woman. She lives with her family in a community of Nahualá. She has 9 children between the ages of 9 and 28. Antonia (who is the first to the right in the picture) is a woman who fights every day to support her family. She has made a living buying and selling traditional clothing for 8 years. She likes this job and she does it from many places around her community, which allows her to also do household jobs and take care of her children. With this job, she contributes to the family expenses. With the desire to keep buying and selling traditional clothing, Antonia is asking for a loan to invest in her business. With this money, she will be able to buy blouses, small bolts of fabric, belts and everything that is related to a clothing line. Antonia dreams of setting up a store where she can showcase her product.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production for the family and to supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Yesenia Elmisa

texts.es:
Yesenia tien 25 años de edad, vive con su conyuge, tiene 1 hijo, con los cuales vive en casa familiar de propiedad de sus padres, en el anexo de Huaca Rajada, en una zona rural, que pertenece al distrito de Pomalca, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, Costa norte de Perú.

Yesenia se dedica a las actividad de venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en su bodega, con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para la compra de más mercaderia y asi poder implementar mas su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para poder atender con mas diversidad de productos, incrementar sus ventas y poder mejorar calidad de su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 25 years of age. She lives with her husband and has 1 child, with whom she lives in a family home owned by her parents close to Huaca Rajada in a rural zone which is part of the Pomalca district, in the provinc of Chichlayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Yesenia earns a living selling groceries and basic need items in her store. With more that three years experience in the business, which is located in her own home, she is requesting a loan to purchase more stock in order to develop her business. This investment will help her to be able to offer a larger range of products, to increase her sales and to be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to develop her business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is age 47 years, married to Florence, and he supports five children.

He has been selling construction materials for the last three years and the business earns him KES 3,500 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase hammers, jemebs and a wheelbarrow so that he can make more construction materials such as stones and meet constructors' needs.

He plans to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to sell milk to clients and earn profits to educate his children.

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase hammers, jemebs and a wheelbarrow so that he can make more construction materials such as stones and meet constructors' needs.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 30 years old, married and supports a family of two children. He has been practicing motorcycle transport for the last 20 years, earning KES 20,000 per month. 

Denis has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production for the family and to supply milk to the area for more income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production for the family and to supply milk to the area for more income.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 27 years old, married to Veronica and he supports four children. He has been a farmer for the last 10 years, and the business earns him KES 6,500 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest for family use and to sell the surplus in the market.  He also plans to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to sell milk to clients and expand his agricultural projects. 

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural activities.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest for family use and to sell the surplus in the market.

loans.name: Maria Daniela

texts.es: Daniela, una señora  que creció en el campo, Daniela vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijas de 5 y 9 años que se encuentran estudiando, Daniela se dedica a la crianza de ganado, ella tiene  terneros y vacas por los que paga arriendo por la hierba, son 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad,  El esposo de Daniela  trabaja de cocinero en un restaurante, Daniela con el diero del credito va a comprar una vaca para criarla y vender la leche que se obtiene de este animal y de ahí apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, y sobre todo para el bienestar y que sigan estudiando sus hijas.
texts.en:
Daniela, a lady who was born in the countryside, lives with her spouse and her two daughters, aged 5 and 9, who are both in school. 

Danielle works rearing cattle, she has calves and cows, for which she pays rent for pastureland. She has been doing this for six years. 

Daniela's spouse works as a chef in a restaurant. 

Wth the money from this loan, Daniela will buy a cow to raise and sell the milk that it produces. This way she will be able to support her husband with the household costs, but most of all will go towards her daughters' well being, and to ensure they can continue studying.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Wilson Omar

texts.es: A sus 28 años de edad Omar es un joven trabajador, el se dedica al jornal y a la crianza de terneros, Omar vive solamente con su hermano de 12 años ya que su madre los abandono hace 3 años para irse a vivir con otro señor, Desde ese tiempo es Omar quien está pendiente de su hermano.  Omar va a invertir el crédito en la compra de terneros, de este negocio aspira seguirse ayudando para que nada les haga falta a él y su hermano.
texts.en: Omar is 28 years old and a young worker. He works as a day laborer and raises calves. Omar lives only with his 12 year old brother because their mother abandoned them 3 years ago to go live with another man. From that moment, Omar looked after his brother. He is going to invest the loan into buying calves. He hopes to continue helping with this business so that he and his brother don't lack anything.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Frankline

texts.en:
Frankline comes from a remote village n the Bomet area of Kenya. He practices dairy, poultry and crop farming to make a living and uses most of his income to meet his family’s basic needs.

Frankline is newly married and is determined to grow his business and improve his new family’s income. He is seeking a loan to buy poultry to produce eggs, chicks, and meat for consumption and sale. He intends to use this loan to buy traditional breeds of chicken because they are well-adapted to local conditions.

With your loan investment into his business, Frankline will make the best out of the increased demand for poultry products in the market. This economic opportunity, once seized, will improve his livelihood and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Jeovanny Alejandro

texts.es: Jeovanny de 25 años de edad, vive junto a su madre a quien le agradece infinitamente por haberlo sacado adelante con sus estudios y brindarle su apoyo toda la vida. Jeovanny es un joven que a pesar de su corta edad siempre busca la manera de aportar todo lo necesario a su hogar, apoyado en su trabajo el cual realiza en una empresa ubicada cerca de su lugar de residencia. Jeovanny con el deseo de poder construir un muro de contención y de esta manera poder sentirse más seguro en su vivienda ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para comprar todos los materiales necesarios como son: ladrillo, arena, hierro, cemento y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Jeovanny, 25 years old, lives with his mother to whom he is infinitely grateful for having gotten him ahead with his studies and offering him her support his whole life. Jeovanny is a young man who, despite his young age, always seeks the way to contribute all that is necessary to his household, supporting it in his work which he does in a business located near his home. Jeovanny, with the desire to be able to construct a retaining wall and in this way be able to feel safer in his house, has decided to ask FUSAI for this loan to purchase all the materials necessary such as brick, sand, metal, and cement, and to pay labor costs.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, sand, metal, cement, and pay labor costs to build a retaining wall for his house.

loans.name: Concepter

texts.en:
Concepter is 54 years old and married to Bernard.  She supports four children. 

She has been selling maize cereals to clients for the last 15 years, and the business earns her KES 3,200 per month.  She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more stocks of maize cereals for sale to clients and to meet both family and client needs. She plans to use the earned profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and to expand her business activities. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and to start a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize cereals for sale to clients and to meet both family and client needs.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana de 33 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su grupo familiar conformado por sus padres y sus dos hijos de 13 y 6 años de edad quienes se dedican a estudiar. Ana es una mujer luchadora que día con día sale a trabajar para poder ganar un sueldo que le permita ayudar con la economía del hogar, ella se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos en casa particular y gracias a esta actividad es como se gana la vida. Ana además de ser una mujer trabajadora es una excelente madre que siempre busca la manera de brindar a su familia toda la protección posible es por ello que pensando en mejorar el techo de su vivienda el cual se encuentra en malas condiciones a tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI el cual le permita invertir en la compra de: lámina, polines y pines para realizar el cambio de techo de su casa  lo antes posible.
texts.en: Ana, 33 years old, is a single mother and lives with her family made up of her parents and her two children, ages 13 and 6, who are students.  Ana is a determined woman who goes out each day to work to be able to earn a salary that allows her to help with the household economy. She works providing domestic services in a home and thanks to this work, she earns her living. Ana, in addition to being a hard-working woman, is an excellent mother who always seeks a way to offer her family all the protection possible and for this she is thinking of improving the roof on her house which is in bad condition. She has decided to ask FUSAI for a loan which will allow her to invest in the purchase of metal sheeting, beams, and pins to replace the roof on her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting, beams, and pins to replace the roof on her house as soon as possible.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is age 23 years, married to Geoffrey, and she supports three children.

She has been a farmer for the last five years, and the business earns her KES 25,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to get a better harvest for sale to clients and for use by her family.

She plans to use gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and expand her agricultural projects.

Her hope is to improve her family living standards and expand her agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to get a better harvest for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production for the family and to supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: José Rafaél

texts.es:
José es un joven de 37 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Sololá.
José es un hombre que se preocupa por su familia y es de las personas que tiene la visión de superarse, el desde hace dos años, tomo la iniciativa de trabajar como sastre, él cuenta que escogió  esta labor por es una de las actividades más rentables y muy poca gente se dedica a esta actividad.
José por ser un joven dedicado y que se esmera  en su trabajo, cuenta con muchos clientes y él ahora se ha dado cuenta que necesita de una maquina industrial un poco más moderno para mejorar su costura, es  la razón que a él lo motiva para solicitar un crédito de Q 10,600.00 para ofrecerle a sus clientes mejor calidad de costura.
José con sus ganancias que obtenga estará  pagando el crédito, y también sueña con poder comprar un terreno donde pueda construir su casa.
texts.en: José is 37 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings in a community of Sololá. José is a man who cares about his family and is someone who has a vision of excelling. Two years ago he made the decision to work as a tailor. He says that he chose this work because it is one of the most challenging jobs and very few people make a living in that job. José has many customers from being a dedicated young man who works hard at his job and now he has realized that he needs a more modern industrial machine to improve his sewing. That is the reason that motivates him to ask for a loan of 10,600.00 Q to offer his customers better quality sewing. José will be paying off the loan with the earnings that he receives. He also dreams of being able to buy land where he could build his house.

loans.use: to buy an industrial machine.

loans.name: Irma Liliana

texts.es: A sus 24 años de edad Liliana es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 7 años mismos que están estudiando, su esposo trabaja al jornal de trabajo de agricultura, Liliana necesita el crédito para comprar pollos, comenta que vive arrendando y que hay un pequeño espacio donde puede criar pollos, la aspiración de Liliana es construir un galpón para criar pollos en mayor cantidad y de ahí mejorar su negocio que esto le permite darle lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en: At 24 years old, Liliana is married and has 2 children who are 5 and 7 years old and are in school. Her husband works as a day laborer in agriculture work. Liliana needs the loan to buy chickens. She says that she leases the place that she lives in and there is a small space where she can grow chickens. Liliana's wish is to build a warehouse to raise chickens in greater quantities and thus improve her business, which allows her to give her children what they need.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Makaritha

texts.en:
Makaritha is age 53 years, married to Joseph, and she supports five children.

She has been offering tailoring services to customers for the last 12 years and the business earns her KES 6,500 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase stocks of cloth for making clothes and meeting clients' needs and those of her family.

She plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and purchase farm inputs for a better harvest for sale to clients.

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of cloth for making clothes and meeting clients' needs and those of her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production to earn more income so as to expand her farming.

loans.name: Las Sirenitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS SIRENITAS” iniciarán el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Úrsula es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de artefactos, venta de CD’s, venta de ropa, veta de cosméticos, venta de comida, venta de pan y pasteles. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Úrsula es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a  Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de una amiga hace varios años. 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos por mayor) que adquirirá de la empresa de cosméticos y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación, el área de salud y los ahorros que ofrece la institución.

En la foto aparecen solo siete integrantes de la A.C. ya que la señora Lidia, después del desembolso, se tuvo que ir a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The A.C. “Las Sirenitas” will begin their sixth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. It consists of eight members and is directed by an administrative panel where Ursula is President. The businesses that the members of the communal association carry out are varied and include: selling artifacts, CD’s, clothing, cosmetics, food, bread and desserts. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesses where Ursula is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer by her friend’s invitation, who is a member of the institution. She has currently a cosmetics business; she shares that she learned about this business through a friend several years ago. 

The loan that she will take out now is to increase capital (to buy cosmetics wholesale) that she will acquire from the cosmetic company and afterwards will sell in her booth. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has two children. 

When asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training, the health area, and the savings that the institution offers. 
Pictured are only seven members of the A.C. since Lidia, after her payment, had to go to her booth.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale.
